moderate	O
to	O
high	O
mylonised	O
phyllite/metasediments.	O

Visible	O
gold	O
recorded	O
is	O
associated	O
with	O
arsenopyrite	O
and	O
euhedral	O
pyrite	O
and	O
contained	O
within	O
a	O
carbonate-quartz-sericite-biotite	O
mylonite	O
proximal	O
to	O
stockworked	O
carbonate-quartz	O
veining.	O

-	O

Arsenic	O
levels	O
are	O
high	O
in	O
the	O
region	O
on	O
the	O
whole.	O

-	O

The	O
top	O
of	O
fresh	O
rock	O
ranges	O
from	O
between	O
85	O
and	O
125m.	O

-	O

Gold	O
mineralisation	O
relates	O
to	O
carbonate-quartz	O
stockworks	O
and	O
veins	O
hosted	O
by	O
a	O
sheared	O
,	O
carbonate	O
flooded	O
,	O
mafic-ultramafic	O
volcanic	O
succession.	O

-	O

There	O
is	O
very	O
obviously	O
carbonate	O
rich	O
fluid	O
flows	O
and	O

transitional	O

•	O

collars	O
are	O
all	O

by	O

to	O
a	O
precision	O
of	O
0.05m.	O

•	O

data	O
is	O

to	O
<1m.	O

project	O

walk-overs.	O

of	O
grades.	O

ABOUT	O
LATITUDE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
Latitude	O
Consolidated	O
(	O
ASX	O
:	O
LCD	O
)	O
is	O
a	O
junior	O
gold	O
explorer	O
with	O
a	O
portfolio	O
of	O
exploration	O
projects	O
across	O
Western	O
Australia	O
and	O
South	O
Australia.	O

Latitude	O
’	O
s	O
flagship	O
Murchison	O
Gold	O
Project	O
has	O
a	O
combined	O
343km	O
²	O

landholding	O
in	O
the	O
prolific	O
Murchison	O
Gold	O
Fields	O
of	O
Western	O
Australia	O
and	O
hosts	O
a	O
large	O
high	O
grade	O
1.1Moz	O
Mineral	O
Resource.	O

The	O
company	O
is	O
actively	O

on	O
this	O
tenure	O
while	O
also	O
progressing	O
mining	O
studies	O
to	O
determine	O
the	O
best	O
pathway	O
to	O
production.	O

The	O
Circle	O
Valley	O
project	O
in	O
southern	O
WA	O
sits	O
in	O
the	O
Albany	O
Fraser	O

is	O
also	O
home	O
to	O

gold	O
mine	O
(	O
3Moz	O
past	O
production	O
)	O
.	O

gold	O

at	O

for	O

FORWARD	O
LOOKING	O
STATEMENTS	O
Certain	O
statements	O
in	O
this	O
report	O
relate	O
to	O
the	O
future	O
,	O
including	O
forward	O
looking	O

to	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
financial	O
position	O
,	O
strategy	O
and	O
expected	O
operating	O
results.	O

These	O
forward-looking	O
statements	O
involve	O
known	O
and	O
unknown	O
risks	O
,	O
uncertainties	O
,	O
assumptions	O
and	O
other	O
important	O
factors	O
that	O
could	O
cause	O
the	O
actual	O
results	O
,	O
performance	O
or	O
achievements	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
to	O
be	O
materially	O
different	O
from	O
future	O
results	O
,	O
performance	O
or	O
achievements	O
expressed	O
or	O
implied	O
by	O
such	O
statements.	O

Actual	O
events	O
or	O
results	O
may	O
differ	O
materially	O
from	O
the	O
events	O
or	O
results	O
expressed	O
or	O
implied	O
in	O
any	O
forward-looking	O
statement	O
and	O
deviations	O
are	O
both	O
normal	O
and	O
to	O
be	O
expected.	O

Other	O
than	O
required	O
by	O
law	O
,	O
neither	O
the	O
Company	O
,	O
their	O
officers	O
nor	O
any	O
other	O
person	O
gives	O
any	O
representation	O
,	O
assurance	O
or	O
guarantee	O
that	O
the	O
occurrence	O
of	O
the	O
events	O
expressed	O
or	O
implied	O
in	O
any	O

Forward	O
Looking	O
Statements	O
Disclaimer	O
This	O
announcement	O
contains	O
forward-looking	O
statements	O
that	O
involve	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
risks	O
and	O
uncertainties.	O

These	O
forward-	O
looking	O
statements	O
are	O
expressed	O
in	O
good	O
faith	O
and	O
believed	O
to	O
have	O
a	O
reasonable	O
basis.	O

These	O
statements	O
reflect	O
current	O
expectations	O
,	O
intentions	O
or	O
strategies	O
regarding	O
the	O
future	O
and	O
assumptions	O
based	O
on	O
currently	O
available	O
information.	O

Should	O
one	O
or	O
more	O
of	O
the	O
risks	O
or	O
uncertainties	O
materialise	O
,	O
or	O
should	O
underlying	O
assumptions	O
prove	O
incorrect	O
,	O
actual	O
results	O
may	O
vary	O
from	O
the	O
expectations	O
,	O
intentions	O
and	O
strategies	O
described	O
in	O
this	O
announcement.	O

issue	O
as	O
weather	O
patterns	O
potentially	O
become	O
less	O
predictable.	O

The	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
approach	O
is	O
to	O
be	O
flexible	O
and	O
adaptive	O
in	O
its	O
response	O
to	O
manage	O
l	O
this	O
potential	O
issue	O
whilst	O
adding	O
water	O
bores	O
and	O
improving	O
site	O
access	O
to	O
be	O
all-weather.	O

a	O

potential	O
vulnerabilities	O
n	O
	O

(	O

,	O

s	O
exploration	O

affect	O
occupational	O

safety	O
;	O
o	O

impact	O
supply	O

of	O

e	O

s	O

This	O

forms	O

of	O

’	O

in	O
accordance	O
with	O

2001	O
and	O

For	O

of	O
this	O
report	O
,	O
u	O
Key	O
Management	O
Personnel	O
(	O
“	O
KMP	O
”	O
)	O
of	O
the	O
Consolidated	O
Entity	O
are	O
defined	O
as	O
those	O
persons	O
having	O
authority	O
and	O
responsibility	O
for	O
planning	O
,	O
directing	O
and	O
controlling	O
the	O
major	O
activities	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
and	O
the	O
Consolidated	O
Entity	O
,	O
directly	O
or	O
indirectly	O
,	O
including	O
any	O
director	O
(	O
whether	O
executive	O
or	O
otherwise	O
)	O
of	O
the	O
Parent	O
Entity.	O

l	O
a	O
Remuneration	O
Policy	O
The	O
Company	O
Constitution	O
provides	O
that	O
the	O
remuneration	O
of	O
non-executive	O
Directors	O
will	O
be	O
not	O
n	O
more	O
than	O
the	O
aggregate	O
fixed	O
sum	O
determined	O
by	O
a	O
general	O
meeting.	O

The	O
aggregate	O
remuneration	O
for	O
non-executive	O
Directors	O
has	O
been	O
set	O
at	O
an	O
amount	O
not	O
to	O
exceed	O
$250	O
,	O
000	O
per	O
o	O

annum.	O

The	O
remuneration	O
of	O
executive	O
Directors	O
will	O
be	O

by	O
the	O
Directors	O
and	O
may	O
be	O

by	O
way	O
of	O

or	O

fee.	O

INDEMNIFICATION	O
AND	O
INSURANCE	O
OF	O
OFFICERS	O
The	O
Company	O
has	O
agreed	O
to	O
indemnify	O
all	O
of	O
the	O
Directors	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
for	O
any	O
liabilities	O
to	O
another	O
person	O
(	O
other	O
than	O
the	O
Company	O
or	O
related	O
body	O
corporate	O
)	O
that	O
may	O
arise	O
from	O
their	O
y	O
position	O
as	O
Directors	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
and	O
its	O
controlled	O
entities	O
,	O
except	O
where	O
the	O
liability	O
arises	O
out	O
of	O
conduct	O
involving	O
a	O
lack	O
of	O
good	O
faith.	O

During	O
the	O
financial	O
year	O
the	O
Company	O
paid	O
a	O
l	O
premium	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
a	O
contract	O
insuring	O
the	O
Directors	O
and	O
officers	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
and	O
its	O
n	O
controlled	O

1.	O

Corporate	O
information	O

Nelson	O

(	O

“	O

”	O
)	O
,	O
a	O
company	O
y	O

in	O

for	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2021.	O

The	O
presentation	O
currency	O
of	O
the	O
Consolidated	O
Entity	O
is	O
Australian	O
Dollars	O
(	O
“	O
$	O
”	O
)	O
.	O

A	O
description	O
of	O
the	O
Consolidated	O
Entity	O
’	O
s	O
l	O
operations	O
is	O
included	O
in	O
the	O
review	O
and	O
results	O
of	O
operations	O
in	O
the	O
Directors	O
’	O
Report.	O

The	O
n	O
Directors	O
’	O
Report	O
is	O
not	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O

The	O
Consolidated	O
Entity	O
is	O
a	O
for-profit	O
entity	O
and	O
limited	O
by	O
shares	O
incorporated	O
in	O
Australia	O
whose	O
shares	O
are	O
traded	O
under	O
the	O
ASX	O
code	O
o	O

“	O
NES	O
”	O
.	O

The	O
financial	O
statements	O
were	O
authorised	O
for	O
issue	O
on	O
30	O
September	O
2021	O
by	O
the	O
Directors	O
of	O
the	O
Consolidated	O
Entity.	O

The	O
Directors	O
have	O
the	O
power	O
to	O
amend	O
and	O
reissue	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O

The	O
principal	O
accounting	O
policies	O
adopted	O
in	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
set	O
out	O
below.	O

e	O
2.	O

Accounting	O
policies	O
s	O
The	O
principal	O
accounting	O
policies	O
adopted	O
in	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
these	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
set	O
u	O
out	O
below.	O

These	O
policies	O
have	O
been	O
consistently	O
applied	O
to	O
all	O
the	O
periods	O
presented	O
,	O
unless	O
otherwise	O
stated.	O

a.	O

Basis	O
of	O
preparation	O
l	O
This	O
general	O
purpose	O
financial	O
report	O
has	O
been	O
prepared	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
a	O
Standards	O
,	O
including	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Interpretations	O
,	O
other	O
authoritative	O
pronouncements	O
of	O
the	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
Board	O
and	O
the	O
Corporations	O
Act	O
2001.	O

Nelson	O
Resources	O
n	O
Limited	O
is	O
a	O
for-profit	O
entity	O
for	O
the	O
purpose	O
of	O
preparing	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O

The	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
presented	O
in	O
Australian	O
dollars	O
and	O
have	O
been	O
prepared	O
under	O
the	O
historical	O
cost	O
o	O

convention.	O

s	O
b.	O

Going	O
concern	O
The	O
annual	O
financial	O
report	O
has	O
been	O
prepared	O
on	O
the	O
going	O
concern	O
basis	O
,	O
which	O
contemplates	O
r	O
continuity	O
of	O
normal	O
business	O
activities	O
and	O
the	O
realisation	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
settlement	O
of	O
liabilities	O
in	O
the	O
ordinary	O
course	O
of	O
business.	O

The	O
Consolidated	O
Entity	O
incurred	O
a	O
loss	O
from	O
ordinary	O
activities	O
e	O
of	O
$3	O
,	O
097	O
,	O
367	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2021	O
(	O
2020	O
:	O
loss	O
$723	O
,	O
634	O
)	O
and	O
net	O
cash	O
outflows	O
from	O
operating	O
activities	O
of	O
$2	O
,	O
860	O
,	O
842	O
(	O
2020	O
:	O
$829	O
,	O
260	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
net	O
working	O
deficit	O
position	O
of	O
the	O
p	O
Consolidated	O
Entity	O
at	O
30	O
June	O
2021	O
was	O
$72	O
,	O
761	O
(	O
2020	O
:	O
$120	O
,	O
084	O
net	O
working	O
capital	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
Consolidated	O
Entity	O
has	O
exploration	O
commitments	O
due	O
within	O
the	O
next	O
12	O
months.	O

Subsequent	O
to	O
year	O
end	O
,	O
the	O
Company	O
completed	O
a	O
renounceable	O
entitlements	O
issue	O
and	O
placement	O
which	O
raised	O
r	O
a	O
total	O
of	O
$2	O
,	O
294	O
,	O
493.	O

The	O
Directors	O
have	O
prepared	O
a	O
cash	O
flow	O
forecast	O
,	O
which	O
indicates	O
that	O
the	O
Consolidated	O
Entity	O
will	O
have	O
sufficient	O
cash	O
flows	O
to	O
meet	O
all	O
commitments	O
and	O
working	O
capital	O
o	O

requirements	O
for	O
the	O
12	O
month	O
period	O
from	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
signing	O
this	O
financial	O
report.	O

Based	O
on	O
the	O
cash	O
flow	O
forecasts	O
and	O
other	O
factors	O
referred	O
to	O
above	O
,	O
the	O
Directors	O
are	O
satisfied	O
that	O
the	O
going	O
F	O
concern	O
basis	O
of	O
preparation	O
is	O
appropriate.	O

Should	O
the	O
Consolidated	O
Entity	O
be	O
unable	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
it	O
may	O
be	O
required	O
to	O
realise	O
its	O
assets	O
and	O
extinguish	O
its	O
liabilities	O
other	O
than	O
in	O
the	O
normal	O
course	O
of	O
business	O
and	O
at	O
amounts	O
different	O
to	O
those	O
stated	O
in	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O

Nelson	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
and	O
Controlled	O
Entities	O
35	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
continued	O
FOR	O
THE	O
YEAR	O
ENDED	O
30	O
JUNE	O
2021	O
2.	O

Accounting	O
policies	O
(	O
continued	O
)	O
The	O
financial	O
statements	O
do	O
not	O
include	O
any	O
adjustments	O
relating	O
to	O
the	O
recoverability	O
and	O
y	O
classification	O
of	O
asset	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
or	O
to	O
the	O
amount	O
and	O
classification	O
of	O
liabilities	O
that	O
might	O
result	O
should	O
the	O
Consolidated	O
Entity	O
be	O
unable	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
and	O
meet	O
its	O
debts	O
l	O
as	O
and	O
when	O
they	O
fall	O
due.	O

n	O
c.	O

Principles	O
of	O
consolidation	O
o	O

The	O
financial	O
statements	O
incorporate	O
the	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
of	O
all	O
subsidiaries	O
of	O
Nelson	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
and	O
the	O
results	O
of	O
all	O
subsidiaries	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
then	O
ended.	O

Subsidiaries	O
are	O
all	O
entities	O
(	O
including	O
structured	O
entities	O
)	O
over	O
which	O
the	O
Company	O
has	O
control.	O

The	O
Company	O
e	O
controls	O
an	O
entity	O
when	O
the	O
Company	O
is	O
exposed	O
to	O
,	O
or	O
has	O
rights	O
to	O
,	O
variable	O
returns	O
from	O
its	O
involvement	O
with	O
the	O
entity	O
and	O
has	O
the	O
ability	O
to	O
affect	O
those	O
returns	O
through	O
its	O
power	O
to	O
direct	O
the	O
activities	O
of	O
the	O
entity.	O

Subsidiaries	O
are	O
fully	O
consolidated	O
from	O
the	O
date	O
on	O
which	O
control	O
is	O
s	O
transferred	O
to	O
the	O
Company.	O

They	O
are	O
de-consolidated	O
from	O
the	O
date	O
that	O
control	O
ceases.	O

The	O
acquisition	O
method	O
of	O
accounting	O
is	O
used	O
to	O
account	O
for	O
business	O
combinations	O
by	O
the	O
Company.	O

u	O
The	O
financial	O
statements	O
of	O
the	O
subsidiaries	O
are	O
prepared	O
for	O
the	O
same	O
reporting	O
period	O
as	O
the	O
parent	O
entity	O
,	O
using	O
consistent	O
accounting	O
policies.	O

In	O
preparing	O
the	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
statements	O
,	O
all	O
intercompany	O
transactions	O
,	O
balances	O
and	O
unrealised	O
gains	O
on	O
transactions	O
l	O
between	O
companies	O
are	O
eliminated.	O

Unrealised	O
losses	O
are	O
also	O
eliminated	O
unless	O
the	O
transaction	O
a	O
provides	O
evidence	O
of	O
the	O
impairment	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
transferred.	O

Accounting	O
policies	O
of	O
subsidiaries	O
have	O
been	O
changed	O
where	O
necessary	O
to	O
ensure	O
consistency	O
with	O
the	O
policies	O
adopted	O
by	O
the	O
Company.	O

Non-controlling	O
interests	O
in	O
the	O
results	O
and	O
equity	O
of	O
subsidiaries	O
are	O
shown	O
separately	O
n	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
,	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position	O
and	O
statement	O
of	O
changes	O
in	O
equity	O
respectively.	O

o	O

The	O
Company	O
treats	O
transactions	O
with	O
non-controlling	O
interests	O
that	O
do	O
not	O
result	O
in	O
a	O
loss	O
of	O
control	O
as	O
transactions	O
with	O
equity	O
owners	O
of	O
the	O
Company.	O

A	O
change	O
in	O
ownership	O
interest	O
results	O
s	O
in	O
an	O
adjustment	O
between	O
the	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
of	O
the	O
controlling	O
and	O
non-controlling	O
interests	O
to	O
reflect	O
their	O
relative	O
interests	O
in	O
the	O
subsidiary.	O

Any	O
difference	O
between	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
r	O
adjustment	O
to	O
non-controlling	O
interests	O
and	O
any	O
consideration	O
paid	O
or	O
received	O
is	O
recognised	O
e	O
within	O
equity	O
attributable	O
to	O
owners	O
of	O
Nelson	O
Resources	O
Limited.	O

When	O
the	O
Company	O
ceases	O
to	O
have	O
control	O
,	O
joint	O
control	O
or	O
significant	O
influence	O
,	O
any	O
retained	O
interest	O
in	O
the	O
entity	O
is	O
remeasured	O
p	O
to	O
its	O
fair	O
value	O
with	O
the	O
change	O
in	O
carrying	O
amount	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

The	O
fair	O

n	O

This	O

and	O

about	O
the	O
resources	O
,	O
the	O

of	O
expected	O
cash	O
o	O

flows	O

or	O
loss.	O

Costs	O

site	O

the	O

of	O
the	O

of	O

r	O

works.	O

n	O

will	O
only	O
be	O
brought	O
n	O
to	O
account	O
if	O
future	O
assessable	O
income	O
is	O
derived	O
of	O
a	O
nature	O
and	O
of	O
an	O
amount	O
sufficient	O
to	O
enable	O
the	O
benefit	O
to	O
be	O
realised	O
and	O
the	O
conditions	O
for	O
deductibility	O
imposed	O
by	O
the	O
relevant	O
tax	O
o	O

legislation	O

to	O
be	O
complied	O
with	O
and	O
no	O
changes	O
in	O
tax	O
legislation	O
adversely	O
affect	O
the	O
Company	O
in	O

the	O
benefit.	O

Accounting	O
policy	O
e	O
Income	O
tax	O
Income	O
tax	O
comprises	O
current	O
and	O
deferred	O
tax.	O

Income	O
tax	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
s	O
except	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
it	O
relates	O
to	O
items	O
recognised	O
directly	O
in	O
equity	O
,	O
in	O
which	O
case	O
it	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
equity.	O

Current	O
tax	O
is	O
the	O
expected	O
tax	O
payable	O
on	O
the	O
taxable	O
income	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
,	O
u	O
using	O
tax	O
rates	O
enacted	O
or	O
substantially	O
enacted	O
at	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
,	O
and	O
any	O
adjustment	O
to	O
tax	O
payable	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
previous	O
years.	O

Deferred	O
tax	O
is	O
provided	O
using	O
the	O
balance	O
sheet	O
method	O
on	O
temporary	O
differences	O
arising	O
between	O
the	O
tax	O
bases	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
and	O
their	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
for	O
financial	O
reporting	O
purposes	O
at	O
the	O
reporting	O
date.	O

Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
are	O
l	O
recognised	O
for	O
all	O
deductible	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
unused	O
tax	O
losses	O
only	O
if	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
a	O
that	O
future	O
taxable	O
amounts	O
will	O
be	O
available	O
to	O
utilise	O
those	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
losses.	O

Deferred	O
tax	O
liabilities	O
and	O
assets	O
are	O
not	O
recognised	O
for	O
temporary	O
differences	O
between	O
the	O
n	O
carrying	O
amount	O
and	O
tax	O
bases	O
of	O
investments	O
in	O
foreign	O
operations	O
where	O
the	O
company	O
is	O
able	O
to	O
control	O
the	O
timing	O
of	O
the	O
reversal	O
of	O
the	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
the	O
o	O

differences	O
will	O
not	O
reverse	O
in	O
the	O
foreseeable	O
future.	O

Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
are	O
offset	O
when	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
legally	O
enforceable	O
right	O
to	O
offset	O
current	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
and	O
when	O
the	O
deferred	O
tax	O
balances	O
relate	O
to	O
the	O
same	O
taxation	O
authority.	O

Current	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
tax	O
liabilities	O
s	O
are	O
offset	O
where	O
the	O
entity	O
has	O
a	O
legally	O
enforceable	O
right	O
to	O
offset	O
and	O
intends	O
either	O
to	O
settle	O
on	O
a	O
net	O
basis	O
,	O
or	O
to	O
realise	O
the	O
asset	O
and	O
settle	O
the	O
liability	O
simultaneously.	O

The	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
r	O
deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
is	O
reviewed	O
at	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
each	O
reporting	O
period	O
and	O
reduced	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
e	O
it	O
is	O
no	O
longer	O
probable	O
that	O
sufficient	O
taxable	O
profit	O
will	O
be	O
available	O
to	O
allow	O
all	O
or	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
deferred	O
income	O
tax	O
asset	O
to	O
be	O
utilised.	O

Unrecognised	O

tax	O
assets	O
are	O

at	O
the	O
p	O
end	O
of	O

and	O

r	O

measuring	O
expected	O
credit	O
losses	O
,	O
which	O
uses	O
a	O
lifetime	O
expected	O
loss	O
p	O
allowance.	O

To	O
measure	O
the	O
expected	O
credit	O
losses	O
,	O
trade	O
receivables	O
have	O
been	O
grouped	O
based	O
on	O
days	O
overdue.	O

Other	O
receivables	O
are	O
recognised	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
,	O
less	O
any	O
allowance	O
for	O
expected	O
credit	O
losses.	O

The	O
allowance	O
for	O
expected	O
credit	O
losses	O
assessment	O
requires	O
a	O
degree	O
of	O
estimation	O
and	O
judgement.	O

It	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
lifetime	O
expected	O
credit	O
loss	O
,	O
grouped	O
based	O
on	O
days	O
r	O
overdue	O
,	O
and	O
makes	O
assumptions	O
to	O
allocate	O
an	O
overall	O
expected	O
credit	O
loss	O
rate	O
for	O
each	O
group.	O

o	O

These	O
assumptions	O
include	O
recent	O
sales	O
experience	O
and	O
historical	O
collection	O
rates.	O

7	O

Plant	O

and	O

are	O
r	O

if	O

,	O

date.	O

An	O
item	O
of	O
property	O
,	O
plant	O
and	O
e	O
equipment	O
is	O
derecognised	O
upon	O
disposal	O
or	O
when	O

no	O

to	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity.	O

and	O

are	O
p	O
taken	O
to	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

to	O
the	O
item	O

to	O
retained	O
profits.	O

in	O
the	O

of	O

and	O
a	O

in	O
a	O

area	O
of	O
interest.	O

that	O

n	O
activities.	O

)	O
.	O

Trade	O
and	O
other	O
payables	O
(	O
continued	O
)	O
Accounting	O
policy	O
y	O
These	O
amounts	O
represent	O
liabilities	O
for	O
goods	O
and	O
services	O
provided	O
to	O
the	O
Company	O
prior	O
to	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
the	O
reporting	O
period	O
that	O
are	O
unpaid.	O

They	O
are	O
unsecured	O
and	O
are	O
usually	O
paid	O
within	O
30	O
l	O
days	O
of	O
recognition.	O

Trade	O
and	O
other	O
payables	O
are	O
presented	O
as	O
current	O
liabilities	O
unless	O
payment	O
n	O
is	O
not	O
due	O
within	O
12	O
months	O
from	O
the	O
reporting	O
date.	O

They	O
are	O
recognised	O
initially	O
at	O
their	O
fair	O
value	O
and	O
subsequently	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
using	O
the	O
effective	O
interest	O
method.	O

Accounting	O
policy	O
A	O
lease	O
liability	O
is	O
recognised	O
at	O
the	O
commencement	O
date	O
of	O
a	O
lease.	O

The	O
lease	O
liability	O
is	O
initially	O
p	O
recognised	O
at	O
the	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
lease	O
payments	O
to	O
be	O
made	O
over	O
the	O
term	O
of	O
the	O
lease	O
,	O
discounted	O
using	O
the	O
interest	O
rate	O
implicit	O
in	O
the	O
lease	O
or	O
,	O
if	O
that	O
rate	O
cannot	O
be	O
readily	O
determined	O
,	O
the	O
Consolidated	O
Entity's	O
incremental	O
borrowing	O
rate	O
,	O
which	O
has	O
been	O
set	O
at	O
3.95%.	O

There	O
is	O
an	O
option	O
to	O
extend	O
the	O
lease.	O

Lease	O
payments	O
comprise	O
of	O
fixed	O
payments	O
less	O
any	O
lease	O
r	O
incentives	O
receivable	O
,	O
variable	O
lease	O
payments	O
that	O
depend	O
on	O
an	O
index	O
or	O
a	O
rate	O
,	O
amounts	O
o	O

expected	O
to	O
be	O
paid	O
under	O
residual	O
value	O
guarantees	O
,	O
exercise	O
price	O
of	O
a	O
purchase	O
option	O
when	O
the	O
exercise	O
of	O
the	O
option	O
is	O
reasonably	O
certain	O
to	O
occur	O
,	O
and	O
any	O
anticipated	O
termination	O
penalties.	O

The	O
variable	O
lease	O
payments	O
that	O
do	O
not	O
depend	O
on	O
an	O
index	O
or	O
a	O
rate	O
are	O
expensed	O
in	O
F	O
the	O
period	O
in	O
which	O
they	O
are	O
incurred.	O

Lease	O
liabilities	O
are	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
using	O
the	O
effective	O
interest	O
method.	O

The	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
are	O
remeasured	O
if	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
change	O
in	O
the	O
following	O
:	O
future	O
lease	O
payments	O
arising	O
from	O
a	O
change	O
in	O
an	O
index	O
or	O
a	O
rate	O
used	O
;	O
residual	O
guarantee	O
;	O
lease	O
term	O
;	O
certainty	O
of	O
a	O
purchase	O
option	O
and	O
termination	O
penalties.	O

49	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
continued	O
FOR	O
THE	O
YEAR	O
ENDED	O
30	O
JUNE	O
2021	O
15.	O

Contributed	O
equity	O
(	O
continued	O
)	O
y	O
Capital	O
management	O
The	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
objectives	O
when	O
managing	O
capital	O
are	O
to	O
safeguard	O
its	O
ability	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
l	O
going	O
concern	O
,	O
so	O
that	O
it	O
may	O
continue	O
to	O
provide	O
returns	O
for	O
shareholders	O
and	O
benefits	O
for	O
other	O
n	O
stakeholders.	O

Due	O
to	O
the	O
nature	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
activities	O
,	O
being	O
mineral	O
exploration	O
,	O
it	O
does	O
not	O
have	O
ready	O
access	O
to	O
credit	O
facilities	O
and	O
therefore	O
is	O
not	O
subject	O
to	O
any	O
externally	O
imposed	O
o	O

capital	O
requirements	O
,	O
with	O
the	O
primary	O
source	O
of	O
Company	O
funding	O
being	O
equity	O
raisings.	O

Accordingly	O
,	O
the	O
objective	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
capital	O
risk	O
management	O
is	O
to	O
balance	O
the	O
current	O
working	O
capital	O
position	O
against	O
the	O
requirements	O
to	O
meet	O
exploration	O
programmes	O
and	O
corporate	O
overheads.	O

This	O
is	O
achieved	O
by	O
maintaining	O
appropriate	O
liquidity	O
to	O
meet	O
anticipated	O
e	O
operating	O
requirements	O
,	O
with	O
a	O
view	O
to	O

Market	O

ratings.	O

o	O

Interest	O
rate	O
risk	O
Interest	O
rate	O
risk	O
is	O
the	O
risk	O
that	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
future	O
cash	O
flows	O
of	O
a	O
financial	O
instrument	O
will	O
s	O
fluctuate	O
due	O
to	O
changes	O
in	O
market	O
interest	O
rates.	O

Current	O
financial	O
assets	O
and	O
financial	O
liabilities	O
are	O
generally	O
not	O
exposed	O
to	O
interest	O
rate	O
risk	O
because	O
of	O
their	O
short-term	O
nature.	O

The	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
r	O
cash	O
and	O
cash	O
equivalents	O
at	O
30	O
June	O
2021	O
are	O
fixed	O
interest	O
rate	O
financial	O
instruments.	O

Therefore	O
,	O
they	O
are	O
not	O
subject	O
to	O
interest	O
rate	O
risk.	O

e	O
Fair	O
value	O
measurements	O
p	O
The	O
fair	O
values	O
of	O
cash	O
,	O
receivables	O
,	O
trade	O
and	O
other	O
payables	O
approximate	O
their	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
as	O
a	O
result	O
of	O
their	O
short	O
maturity.	O

When	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
,	O
financial	O
or	O
non-financial	O
,	O
is	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
for	O
recognition	O
or	O
disclosure	O
purposes	O
,	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
price	O
that	O
would	O
be	O
received	O
to	O
sell	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
paid	O
to	O
transfer	O
a	O
liability	O
in	O
an	O
orderly	O
transaction	O
between	O
market	O
r	O
participants	O
at	O
the	O
measurement	O
date	O
;	O
and	O
assumes	O
that	O
the	O
transaction	O
will	O
take	O
place	O
either	O
:	O
in	O
o	O

the	O
principal	O
market	O
;	O
or	O
in	O
the	O
absence	O
of	O
a	O
principal	O
market	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
most	O
advantageous	O
market.	O

Fair	O
value	O
is	O
measured	O
using	O
the	O
assumptions	O
that	O
market	O
participants	O
would	O
use	O
when	O
pricing	O
the	O
F	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
,	O
assuming	O
they	O
act	O
in	O
their	O
economic	O
best	O
interests.	O

For	O
non-financial	O
assets	O
,	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
measurement	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
its	O
highest	O
and	O
best	O
use.	O

Nelson	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
and	O

Entities	O
53	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O

YEAR	O

Financial	O
instruments	O
(	O
continued	O
)	O
Valuation	O
techniques	O
that	O
are	O
appropriate	O
in	O
the	O
circumstances	O
and	O
for	O
which	O
sufficient	O
data	O
are	O
y	O
available	O
to	O
measure	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
are	O
used	O
,	O
maximising	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
relevant	O
observable	O
inputs	O
and	O
minimising	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
unobservable	O
inputs.	O

Assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
are	O
l	O
classified	O
into	O
three	O
levels	O
,	O
using	O
a	O
fair	O
value	O
hierarchy	O
that	O
reflects	O
the	O
significance	O
of	O
the	O
inputs	O
n	O
used	O
in	O
making	O
the	O
measurements.	O

Classifications	O
are	O
reviewed	O
at	O
each	O
reporting	O
date	O
and	O
transfers	O
between	O
levels	O
are	O
determined	O
based	O
on	O
a	O
reassessment	O
of	O
the	O
lowest	O
level	O
of	O
input	O
that	O
o	O

is	O
significant	O
to	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
measurement.	O

For	O
recurring	O
and	O
non-recurring	O
fair	O
value	O
measurements	O
,	O
external	O
valuers	O
may	O
be	O
used	O
when	O
internal	O
expertise	O
is	O
either	O
not	O
available	O
or	O
when	O
the	O
valuation	O
is	O
deemed	O
to	O
be	O
significant.	O

External	O
valuers	O
are	O
selected	O
based	O
on	O
market	O
knowledge	O
and	O
reputation.	O

Where	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
significant	O
change	O
in	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
e	O
from	O
one	O
period	O
to	O
another	O
,	O
an	O
analysis	O
is	O
undertaken	O
,	O
which	O
includes	O
a	O
verification	O
of	O
the	O
major	O
inputs	O
applied	O
in	O
the	O
latest	O
valuation	O
and	O
a	O
comparison	O
,	O
where	O
applicable	O
,	O
with	O
external	O
sources	O
s	O
of	O
data.	O

u	O
Accounting	O
policy	O
Investments	O
and	O
other	O
financial	O
assets	O
Investments	O
and	O
other	O
financial	O
assets	O
are	O
initially	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value.	O

Transaction	O
costs	O
are	O
included	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
initial	O
measurement	O
,	O
except	O
for	O
financial	O
assets	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
l	O
or	O
loss.	O

Such	O
assets	O
are	O
subsequently	O
measured	O
at	O
either	O
amortised	O
cost	O
or	O
fair	O
value	O
depending	O
a	O
on	O
their	O
classification.	O

Classification	O
is	O
determined	O
based	O
on	O
both	O
the	O
business	O
model	O
within	O
which	O
such	O
assets	O
are	O
held	O
and	O
the	O
contractual	O
cash	O
flow	O
characteristics	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
asset	O
unless	O
,	O
an	O
n	O
accounting	O
mismatch	O
is	O
being	O
avoided.	O

Financial	O
assets	O
are	O
derecognised	O
when	O
the	O
rights	O
to	O
receive	O
cash	O
flows	O
have	O
expired	O
or	O
have	O
been	O
transferred	O
and	O
the	O
Consolidated	O
Entity	O
has	O
o	O

transferred	O
substantially	O
all	O
the	O
risks	O
and	O
rewards	O
of	O
ownership.	O

When	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
reasonable	O
expectation	O
of	O
recovering	O
part	O
or	O
all	O
of	O
a	O
financial	O
asset	O
,	O
it's	O
carrying	O
value	O
is	O
written	O
off.	O

s	O
Financial	O
assets	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
Financial	O
assets	O
not	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
or	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
r	O
income	O
are	O
classified	O
as	O
financial	O
assets	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

Typically	O
,	O
such	O
financial	O
e	O
assets	O
will	O
be	O
either	O
:	O
(	O
i	O
)	O

for	O
trading	O
,	O
where	O

)	O

as	O
such	O

recognition	O
where	O
permitted.	O

movements	O
are	O

in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

p	O

instruments	O

)	O
Impairment	O
of	O
financial	O
assets	O
y	O
The	O
Consolidated	O
Entity	O
recognises	O
a	O
loss	O
allowance	O
for	O
expected	O
credit	O
losses	O
on	O
financial	O
assets	O
which	O
are	O
either	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
or	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income.	O

l	O
The	O
measurement	O
of	O
the	O
loss	O
allowance	O
depends	O
upon	O
the	O
Consolidated	O
Entity's	O
assessment	O
at	O
the	O
n	O
end	O
of	O
each	O
reporting	O
period	O
as	O
to	O
whether	O
the	O
financial	O
instrument's	O
credit	O
risk	O
has	O
increased	O
significantly	O
since	O
initial	O
recognition	O
,	O
based	O
on	O
reasonable	O
and	O
supportable	O
information	O
that	O
is	O
o	O

available	O
,	O
without	O
undue	O
cost	O
or	O
effort	O
to	O
obtain.	O

Where	O
there	O
has	O
not	O
been	O
a	O
significant	O
increase	O
in	O
exposure	O
to	O
credit	O
risk	O
since	O
initial	O
recognition	O
,	O
a	O
12-month	O
expected	O
credit	O
loss	O
allowance	O
is	O
estimated.	O

This	O
represents	O
a	O
portion	O
of	O
the	O
asset's	O
lifetime	O
expected	O
credit	O
losses	O
that	O
is	O
attributable	O
to	O
a	O
default	O
event	O
that	O
is	O
possible	O
within	O
the	O
next	O
12	O
months.	O

Where	O
a	O
financial	O
asset	O
e	O
has	O
become	O
credit	O
impaired	O
or	O
where	O
it	O
is	O
determined	O
that	O
credit	O
risk	O
has	O
increased	O
significantly	O
,	O
the	O
loss	O
allowance	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
asset's	O
lifetime	O
expected	O
credit	O
losses.	O

The	O
amount	O
of	O
expected	O
s	O
credit	O
loss	O
recognised	O
is	O
measured	O
on	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
the	O
probability	O
weighted	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
anticipated	O
cash	O
shortfalls	O
over	O
the	O
life	O
of	O
the	O
instrument	O
discounted	O
at	O
the	O
original	O
effective	O
u	O
interest	O
rate.	O

For	O
financial	O
assets	O

at	O

value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
,	O

other	O

income.	O

and	O
to	O
communicate	O
with	O
them	O
all	O
relationships	O
and	O
other	O
matters	O
that	O
may	O
reasonably	O
be	O
thought	O
to	O
bear	O
on	O
our	O
independence	O
,	O
and	O
where	O
applicable	O
,	O
related	O
safeguards.	O

y	O
From	O
the	O
matters	O
communicated	O
with	O
the	O
directors	O
,	O
we	O
determine	O
those	O
matters	O
that	O
were	O
of	O
most	O
significance	O
in	O
the	O
audit	O
l	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
of	O
the	O
current	O
period	O
and	O
are	O
therefore	O
the	O
key	O
audit	O
matters.	O

We	O
describe	O
these	O
matters	O
in	O
our	O
n	O
auditor	O
’	O
s	O
report	O
unless	O
law	O
or	O
regulation	O
precludes	O
public	O
disclosure	O
about	O
the	O
matter	O
or	O
when	O
,	O
in	O
extremely	O
rare	O
circumstances	O
,	O
we	O
determine	O
that	O
a	O
matter	O
should	O
not	O
be	O
communicated	O
in	O
our	O
report	O
because	O
the	O
adverse	O
consequences	O
o	O

of	O
doing	O
so	O
would	O
reasonably	O
be	O
expected	O
to	O
outweigh	O
the	O
public	O
interest	O
benefits	O
of	O
such	O
communication.	O

Report	O
on	O
the	O
Remuneration	O
Report	O
e	O
Opinion	O
on	O
the	O
Remuneration	O
Report	O
s	O
We	O
have	O
audited	O
the	O
Remuneration	O
Report	O
included	O
in	O
pages	O
23	O
to	O
27	O
of	O
the	O
directors	O
’	O
report	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2021.	O

u	O

for	O

of	O

Consolidated	O

Commenting	O
on	O
the	O
final	O
Phase	O
1	O
drilling	O
results	O
,	O
CEO	O
Tim	O
Davidson	O
said	O
:	O
“	O
We	O
are	O
excited	O
by	O
the	O
extremely	O
high	O
grades	O

from	O
St	O
Anne	O
’	O
s	O
which	O
is	O
an	O
important	O
exploration	O
target	O
for	O
us.	O

Importantly	O
,	O
St	O
Anne	O
’	O
s	O
is	O
our	O
second	O
drill	O
location	O
during	O
our	O
recently	O
commenced	O
Phase	O
2	O
drill	O
program	O
and	O
we	O

forward	O
to	O

these	O

are	O
also	O
pleased	O
with	O
the	O
initial	O
results	O
from	O
Judy	O
North	O
where	O
we	O
confirmed	O
the	O
northern	O
extension	O
of	O
the	O
high-grade	O
mineralisation	O
,	O
which	O
currently	O
contains	O
141	O
,	O
000	O
ounces	O
of	O
gold	O
in	O
Mineral	O
Resource.	O

The	O
Andy	O
Well	O
results	O
also	O
demonstrate	O
the	O
very	O
high	O
grade	O
,	O
but	O
extremely	O
nuggety	O
nature	O
of	O
the	O
of	O
the	O
mineralisation	O
with	O
screen	O
fire	O
assay	O
results	O
uplifting	O
the	O
grade	O
of	O
one	O
intercept	O
by	O
50%	O
and	O
the	O
1m	O
sample	O
for	O
another	O
intercept	O
in	O
the	O
same	O
hole	O
returning	O
a	O
grade	O
of	O
6.69g/t	O
,	O
significantly	O
higher	O
than	O
would	O
be	O
expected	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
4m	O
composite	O
grade	O
originally	O
returned	O
from	O
the	O
laboratory.	O

With	O
this	O
in	O
mind	O
,	O
future	O
drilling	O
of	O
the	O
very	O
high-grade	O
mineralisation	O
at	O
Andy	O
Well	O
will	O
primarily	O
be	O
performed	O
with	O
diamond	O
drilling	O
to	O
allow	O
the	O
geology	O
team	O
to	O
better	O
interpret	O
and	O
sample	O
the	O
mineralisation.	O

With	O
these	O
results	O
in	O
hand	O
we	O
look	O
forward	O
to	O
rapidly	O
progressing	O
our	O
Phase	O
2	O
drill	O
program	O
and	O
updating	O
our	O
shareholders	O
as	O
we	O
begin	O
to	O
receive	O
assay	O
results	O
over	O
the	O
coming	O
months.	O

”	O
ST	O
ANNE	O
’	O
S	O
PROSPECT	O
The	O
St	O
Anne	O
’	O
s	O
mineralisation	O
consists	O
of	O
quartz	O
veining	O
and	O
pyrite	O
alteration	O
(	O
as	O
seen	O
at	O
Turnberry	O
)	O
and	O
occurs	O
on	O
a	O
geological	O
contact	O
between	O
mafic	O
dolerite	O
and	O
sedimentary	O
shales.	O

Both	O
rock	O
type	O
’	O
s	O
host	O
mineralisation	O
at	O
Turnberry	O
with	O
the	O
dolerite	O
generally	O
hosting	O
better	O
continuity	O
of	O
mineralisation	O
and	O
higher	O
grades.	O

final	O
1m	O
sample	O
results	O
demonstrate	O
the	O
very	O
high-grade	O
nature	O
of	O
the	O
mineralisation	O
which	O
remains	O
open	O
along	O
strike	O
and	O
both	O
up	O
and	O
down	O
dip	O
at	O
St	O
Anne	O
’	O
s.	O

of	O

targeted	O

quarter	O

JUDY	O
NORTH	O
The	O
drilling	O
at	O
Judy	O
North	O
tested	O
for	O
the	O
continuation	O
of	O
high-grade	O
mineralisation	O
in	O
an	O
area	O
with	O
limited	O
historical	O
drilling.	O

One	O
of	O
the	O
five	O
holes	O
drilled	O
by	O
the	O
Company	O
intersected	O
a	O
high-	O
grade	O
shoot	O
70m	O
below	O
and	O
to	O
the	O
north	O
of	O
drilling	O
completed	O
by	O
Doray	O
Minerals	O
Limited	O
during	O
2015.	O

This	O
indicates	O
a	O
strong	O
northerly	O
plunge	O
component	O
to	O
the	O
mineralisation.	O

The	O
remaining	O
four	O
holes	O
intersected	O
the	O
Judy	O
North	O
lode	O
outside	O
this	O
high-grade	O
shoot.	O

consistency	O
of	O
width	O
in	O
all	O
five	O
holes	O
from	O

1	O

of	O
the	O
mineralised	O
structure	O

target	O
for	O

2	O
drilling.	O

to	O

ABOUT	O
LATITUDE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
Latitude	O
Consolidated	O
(	O
ASX	O
:	O
LCD	O
)	O
is	O
a	O
junior	O
gold	O
explorer	O
with	O
a	O
portfolio	O
of	O
exploration	O
projects	O
across	O
Western	O
Australia.	O

Latitude	O
’	O
s	O
flagship	O
Murchison	O
Gold	O
Project	O
has	O
a	O
combined	O
343km	O
²	O

landholding	O
in	O
the	O
prolific	O
Murchison	O
Gold	O
Fields	O
of	O
Western	O
Australia	O
and	O
hosts	O
a	O
large	O
high	O
grade	O
1.1Moz	O
Mineral	O
Resource.	O

The	O
company	O
is	O
actively	O
exploring	O
on	O
this	O
tenure	O
while	O
also	O
progressing	O
mining	O
studies	O
to	O
determine	O
the	O
best	O
pathway	O
to	O
production.	O

The	O
Circle	O
Valley	O
project	O
in	O
southern	O
WA	O
sits	O
in	O
the	O
Albany	O
Fraser	O
mobile	O
belt.	O

This	O
belt	O
is	O
also	O
home	O
to	O
the	O
Tropicana	O
gold	O
mine	O
(	O
3Moz	O
past	O
production	O
)	O
.	O

Primary	O
gold	O
mineralisation	O
has	O
been	O
identified	O
in	O
two	O
separate	O
locations	O
at	O
Circle	O
Valley	O
and	O
presents	O
an	O
exciting	O
exploration	O
opportunity	O
for	O
Latitude.	O

Global	O
Mineral	O
Resource	O
Summary	O
Notes	O
:	O

Mineral	O
Resources	O
previously	O

to	O

Mineral	O
Resource	O
Grows	O
44%	O
to	O
+1.1	O
Million	O
Ounces	O
”	O
.	O

The	O
Company	O
is	O
not	O
aware	O
of	O
any	O
new	O
information	O
or	O
data	O
that	O
materially	O

the	O

in	O

and	O

parameters	O
underpinning	O
the	O
estimates	O
continue	O
to	O
apply	O
and	O
have	O
not	O

changed.	O

FORWARD	O
LOOKING	O
STATEMENTS	O
Certain	O
statements	O
in	O
this	O
report	O
relate	O
to	O
the	O
future	O
,	O

forward	O
looking	O
statements	O

to	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
financial	O
position	O
,	O
strategy	O
and	O
expected	O
operating	O
results.	O

These	O
forward-looking	O
statements	O
involve	O
known	O
and	O
unknown	O
risks	O
,	O
uncertainties	O
,	O
assumptions	O
and	O
other	O
important	O
factors	O
that	O
could	O
cause	O
the	O
actual	O
results	O
,	O
performance	O
or	O
achievements	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
to	O
be	O
materially	O
different	O
from	O
future	O
results	O
,	O
performance	O
or	O
achievements	O
expressed	O
or	O
implied	O
by	O
such	O
statements.	O

Actual	O
events	O
or	O
results	O
may	O
differ	O
materially	O
from	O
the	O
events	O
or	O
results	O
expressed	O
or	O
implied	O
in	O
any	O
forward-looking	O
statement	O
and	O
deviations	O
are	O
both	O
normal	O
and	O
to	O
be	O
expected.	O

Other	O
than	O
required	O
by	O
law	O
,	O
neither	O
the	O
Company	O
,	O
their	O
officers	O
nor	O
any	O
other	O
person	O
gives	O
any	O
representation	O
,	O
assurance	O
or	O
guarantee	O
that	O
the	O
occurrence	O
of	O
the	O
events	O
expressed	O
or	O
implied	O
in	O
any	O
forward-looking	O
statements	O
will	O
actually	O
occur.	O

You	O
are	O

not	O
to	O
place	O
undue	O
reliance	O
on	O
those	O
statements.	O

WILCHERRY	O
PROJECT	O
,	O
SOUTH	O
AUSTRALIA	O
The	O
Wilcherry	O
Project	O
(	O
Alliance	O
100%	O
)	O
is	O
located	O
within	O
the	O
Gawler	O
Craton	O
,	O
northern	O
Eyre	O
Peninsula	O
,	O
40	O
km	O
north	O
of	O
Kimba	O
in	O
South	O
Australia.	O

Wilcherry	O
comprises	O
seven	O
exploration	O
licences	O
covering	O
1	O
,	O
097	O
km2	O
which	O
are	O
prospective	O
for	O
gold	O
and	O
base	O
metals.	O

During	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2019	O
Alliance	O
’	O
s	O
wholly	O
owned	O
subsidiary	O
Alliance	O
Craton	O
Explorer	O
Pty	O
Ltd	O
(	O
ACE	O
)	O
acquired	O
the	O
balance	O
of	O
the	O
Wilcherry	O
Project	O
(	O
approximately	O
17%	O
at	O
the	O
time	O
of	O
settlement	O
)	O
from	O
Trafford	O

Pty	O
Ltd	O
,	O
and	O
subsidiary	O
of	O
Tyranna	O

,	O

80	O

of	O

Airborne	O
Magnetic	O
Surveys	O
The	O
Company	O
completed	O
a	O
high-resolution	O
magnetic	O
survey	O
over	O
all	O
of	O
the	O
tenements	O
at	O
the	O
Wilcherry	O
Project	O
to	O
better	O
define	O
the	O
regional	O
structure	O
and	O
magnetic	O
iron	O
formation	O
with	O
the	O
potential	O
to	O
host	O
gold	O
similar	O
to	O
Weednanna.	O

A	O
total	O
of	O
18	O
,	O
946	O
line	O
kilometres	O
was	O
surveyed	O
with	O
a	O
fixed	O
wing	O
aircraft	O
flying	O
approximately	O
30m	O
above	O
the	O
ground	O
using	O
a	O
flight	O
line	O
spacing	O
of	O
100m	O
,	O
reducing	O
to	O
50m	O
line	O
spacing	O
over	O
the	O
central	O
tenement	O
(	O
EL6188	O
)	O
,	O
and	O
further	O
reducing	O
to	O
25m	O
line	O
spacing	O
over	O
the	O
Weednanna	O
Gold	O
Deposit.	O

High-resolution	O
magnetic	O
data	O
provides	O
a	O
powerful	O
tool	O
for	O
regional	O
gold	O
exploration	O
as	O
it	O
is	O
able	O
to	O
define	O
major	O
structures	O
that	O
are	O
the	O
conduits	O
for	O
gold-bearing	O
fluids	O
and	O
minor	O
structures	O
that	O
trap	O
and	O
deposit	O
gold.	O

Magnetic	O
data	O
also	O
allows	O
for	O
the	O
mapping	O
of	O
high	O
and	O
low	O
magnetic	O
rock	O
types	O
that	O
may	O
be	O
a	O
favourable	O
host	O
for	O
gold.	O

Prospect	O

gold.	O

7The	O
Weednanna	O
North	O
Prospect	O
,	O
which	O
was	O
not	O
previously	O
targeted	O
for	O
gold	O
,	O
is	O
now	O
considered	O
a	O
priority	O
gold	O
exploration	O
target	O
area.	O

Weednanna	O
East	O
Aircore	O
Drilling	O
85	O
aircore	O
holes	O
were	O
completed	O
at	O
Weednanna	O
East	O
,	O
for	O
3	O
,	O
103	O
metres	O
,	O
to	O
extend	O
known	O
gold	O
in	O
regolith	O
anomalism.	O

Refer	O
to	O
Alliance	O
ASX	O
announcement	O
dated	O
29	O
January	O
2019.	O

Four	O
holes	O
returned	O
greater	O
than	O
100	O
ppb	O
gold	O
with	O
a	O
best	O
result	O
of	O
2m	B-D
@	B-P
1.31	B-P
g/t	I-P
gold	B-M
from	B-E
49m	B-D
in	B-E
18WDAC078.	B-H

A	O
zone	O
of	O
discontinuous	O
>100ppb	O
gold	O
anomalism	O
extends	O
over	O
1	O
,	O
000m	O
and	O
is	O
open	O
in	O
the	O
north.	O

The	O
magnitude	O
and	O
distribution	O
of	O
gold	O
in	O
the	O
regolith	O
may	O
be	O
indicative	O
of	O
primary	O
gold	O
mineralisation	O
and	O
further	O
drilling	O
is	O
warranted	O
to	O
better	O
define	O
the	O
gold	O
in	O
regolith	O
anomalies	O
before	O
bedrock	O
drill	O
testing.	O

Weednanna	O
3DIP	O
Survey	O
A	O
3DIP	O
survey	O
was	O
completed	O
at	O
Weednanna.	O

Refer	O
to	O
Alliance	O
’	O
s	O
ASX	O
announcement	O
dated	O
7	O
March	O
2019.	O

This	O
survey	O
identified	O
nine	O
discrete	O
chargeable	O
anomalies	O
for	O
follow-up	O
assessment.	O

Five	O
out	O
of	O
nine	O
targets	O
are	O
shallow	O
,	O
which	O
highlights	O
the	O
remaining	O
near-surface	O
potential	O
to	O
significantly	O
grow	O
the	O
mineral	O
resource.	O

Some	O
of	O
the	O
largest	O
chargeable	O
anomalies	O
are	O
bounded	O
by	O
a	O
NW-SE	O
trending	O
fault	O
which	O
is	O
known	O
to	O
host	O
gold	O
but	O
has	O
limited	O
drilling	O
to	O
date.	O

Yeltana	O
Graphite	O
Prospect	O
The	O
Yeltana	O
Graphite	O
Prospect	O
(	O
Yeltana	O
)	O
is	O
located	O
40	O
kilometres	O
north-northwest	O
of	O
Kimba.	O

The	O
prospect	O
was	O
first	O
identified	O
by	O
a	O
helicopter	O
borne	O
electromagnetic	O
survey	O
completed	O
in	O
early	O
2017	O
and	O
more	O
accurately	O
defined	O
by	O
a	O
high	O
powered	O
moving-loop	O
electromagnetic	O
survey	O
completed	O
in	O
May	O
and	O
June	O
2017.	O

This	O
survey	O
identified	O
a	O
single	O
strong	O
bedrock	O
anomaly	O
that	O
was	O
modelled	O
as	O
being	O
~600	O
metres	O
by	O
1	O
,	O
200	O
metres	O
in	O
size	O
,	O
high	O
strength	O
(	O
~7	O
,	O
000-10	O
,	O
000	O
siemens	O
(	O
S	O
)	O
)	O
,	O
dipping	O
~60-70	O
degrees	O
southwest	O
,	O
and	O
starting	O
between	O
~50	O
and	O
75	O
metres	O
below	O
surface.	O

In	O
November	O
2017	O
one	O
RC	O
hole	O
(	O
17EMRC001	O
)	O
,	O
totalling	O
192	O
metres	O
,	O
was	O
drilled	O
to	O
test	O
the	O
source	O
of	O
this	O
conductor	O
and	O
intersected	O
39	O
metres	O
@	O
8.0%	O
TGC	O
from	O
116	O
metres.	O

Refer	O
to	O
ASX	O
announcement	O
dated	O
30	O
November	O
2017.	O

During	O
July	O
and	O
August	O
2018	O
,	O
two	O
HQ	O
sized	O
diamond	O
holes	O
(	O
18EMDH006	O
and	O
007	O
)	O
,	O
totalling	O
555.8	O
metres	O
,	O
were	O
drilled	O
to	O
confirm	O
the	O
initial	O
RC	O
drill	O
intersection	O
,	O
complete	O
DHEM	O
surveys	O
to	O
better	O
model	O
the	O
size	O
and	O
geometry	O
of	O
the	O
graphite	O
conductor	O
and	O
provide	O
empirical	O
data	O
to	O
support	O
the	O
estimation	O
of	O
an	O
Exploration	O
Target.	O

Significant	O
drill	O
intersections	O
of	O
graphite	O
averaging	O
greater	O
than	O
5.0	O
%	O
TGC	O
,	O
include	O
:	O
▪	B-E

@	B-E
5.05	B-P

Yeltana	O
Graphite	O
Prospect	O
Exploration	O
Target	O
An	O
Exploration	O
Target	O
was	O
estimated	O
for	O
the	O
Yeltana	O
Graphite	O
Prospect	O
of	O
between	O
24.5	O
million	O
and	O
59.0	O
million	O
tonnes	O
grading	O
between	O
5.5	O
and	O
10.2	O
%	O
total	O
graphitic	O
carbon.	O

The	O
potential	O
quality	O
and	O
grade	O
of	O
this	O
8Exploration	O
Target	O
is	O
conceptual	O
in	O
nature	O
as	O
there	O
has	O
been	O
insufficient	O
exploration	O
to	O
estimate	O
a	O
Mineral	O
Resource	O
and	O
it	O
is	O
uncertain	O
if	O
further	O
exploration	O
will	O
result	O
in	O
the	O
estimation	O
of	O
a	O
Mineral	O
Resource.	O

Refer	O
to	O
Alliance	O
ASX	O
announcement	O
dated	O
4	O
October	O
2018	O
for	O
further	O
details.	O

To	O
assess	O
the	O
potential	O
for	O
commercial	O
viability	O
,	O
four	O
composite	O
samples	O
of	O
graphite	O
mineralisation	O
from	O
diamond	O
holes	O
18EMDH006	O
and	O
007	O
were	O
sent	O
to	O
Bureau	O
Veritas	O
in	O
Adelaide	O
for	O
preliminary	O
metallurgical	O
test	O
work.	O

Although	O
further	O
drilling	O
and	O
metallurgical	O
test	O
work	O
is	O
warranted	O
,	O
Alliance	O
has	O
no	O
immediate	O
work	O
plans	O
for	O
Yeltana	O
due	O
to	O
the	O
higher	O
priority	O
Weednanna	O
Gold	O
Deposit.	O

GUNDOCKERTA	O
SOUTH	O
PROJECT	O
,	O
WESTERN	O
AUSTRALIA	O
(	O
100%	O
)	O
During	O
June	O
2019	O
,	O
a	O
66	O
hole	O
aircore	O
drilling	O
program	O
totalling	O
3	O
,	O
353	O
metres	O
was	O
completed	O
at	O
Gundockerta	O
South.	O

This	O
aircore	O
drilling	O
was	O
designed	O
to	O
test	O
a	O
broad	O
area	O
of	O
sporadic	O
low	O
level	O
gold	O
in	O
soil	O
anomalism	O
,	O
by	O
using	O
wide	O
spaced	O
aircore	O
drill	O
holes	O
to	O
test	O
for	O
low	O
level	O
gold	O
in	O
regolith	O
anomalism	O
that	O
can	O
be	O
used	O
as	O
a	O
vector	O
towards	O
primary	O
gold	O
mineralisation.	O

Post-reporting	O

assay	O

anomalous	O

with	O

in	B-E

regulation	O

activities	O

WA	O

with	O

to	O
those	O

Occupational	O
Health	O
&	O
Safety	O
The	O
group	O
has	O
in	O
place	O
policies	O
to	O
cover	O

of	O
New	O

of	O

,	O

,	O

,	O

to	O

,	O

,	O

for	O
Work	O
and	O
Privacy	O
,	O
and	O
to	O
ensure	O
Quality	O

and	O

of	O
its	O
operations.	O

The	O
group	O
is	O
committed	O
to	O

a	O
safe	O
working	O
environment	O
for	O
employees	O
,	O

and	O
others	O

its	O

,	O

and	O

for	O

Remuneration	O
report	O
(	O
audited	O
)	O
The	O
remuneration	O
report	O
,	O
which	O
has	O
been	O
audited	O
,	O
outlines	O
the	O
director	O
and	O
senior	O
management/executives	O
(	O
Key	O
Management	O
Personnel	O
)	O
remuneration	O
arrangements	O
for	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
and	O
the	O
company	O
for	O
the	O
financial	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2019	O
,	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
requirements	O
of	O
the	O
Corporations	O
Act	O
2001	O
and	O
its	O
Regulations.	O

Key	O
management	O
personnel	O
are	O
those	O
persons	O
having	O
authority	O
and	O
responsibility	O
for	O
planning	O
,	O
directing	O
and	O
controlling	O
the	O
activities	O
of	O
the	O
entity	O
,	O
directly	O
or	O
indirectly	O
,	O
including	O
all	O
directors.	O

The	O
remuneration	O
report	O
is	O
set	O
out	O
under	O
the	O
following	O
main	O
headings	O
:	O
●	O

Principles	O
used	O
to	O
determine	O
the	O
nature	O
and	O
amount	O
of	O
remuneration	O
●	O

Details	O
of	O
remuneration	O
●	O

Service	O
agreements	O
●	O

Share-based	O
compensation	O
●	O

Additional	O
information	O
●	O

Additional	O
disclosures	O
relating	O
to	O
key	O
management	O
personnel	O
Principles	O
used	O
to	O
determine	O
the	O
nature	O
and	O
amount	O
of	O
remuneration	O
The	O
objective	O
of	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity's	O
and	O
company's	O
executive	O
reward	O
framework	O
is	O
to	O
ensure	O
reward	O
for	O
performance	O
is	O
competitive	O
and	O
appropriate	O
for	O
the	O
results	O
delivered.	O

The	O
framework	O
aligns	O
executive	O
reward	O
with	O
the	O
achievement	O
of	O
strategic	O
objectives	O
and	O
the	O
creation	O
of	O
value	O
for	O
shareholders	O
,	O
and	O
conforms	O
with	O
the	O
market	O
best	O
practice	O
for	O
delivery	O
of	O
reward.	O

The	O
Board	O
of	O
Directors	O
(	O
'the	O
Board'	O
)	O
ensures	O
that	O
executive	O
reward	O
satisfies	O
the	O
following	O
key	O
criteria	O
for	O
good	O
reward	O
governance	O
practices	O
:	O
●	O

competitiveness	O
and	O
reasonableness	O
●	O

acceptability	O
to	O
shareholders	O
●	O

performance	O
linkage	O
/	O
alignment	O
of	O
executive	O
compensation	O
●	O

transparency	O
The	O
Remuneration	O
Committee	O
is	O
responsible	O
for	O
determining	O
and	O
reviewing	O
remuneration	O
arrangements	O
for	O
its	O
directors	O
and	O
executives.	O

The	O
performance	O
of	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
and	O
company	O
depends	O
on	O
the	O
quality	O
of	O
its	O
directors	O
and	O
executives.	O

The	O
remuneration	O
philosophy	O
is	O
to	O
attract	O
,	O
motivate	O
and	O
retain	O
high	O
performance	O
and	O
high	O
quality	O
personnel.	O

The	O
committee	O
did	O
not	O
engage	O
the	O
services	O
of	O
a	O
remuneration	O
consultant	O
during	O
the	O
year.	O

15	O
Alliance	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
Directors'	O
report	O
30	O
June	O
2019	O
The	O
Remuneration	O
Committee	O
has	O
structured	O
an	O
executive	O
remuneration	O
framework	O
that	O
is	O
market	O
competitive	O
and	O
complementary	O
to	O
the	O
reward	O
strategy	O
of	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
and	O
company.	O

The	O
reward	O
framework	O
is	O
designed	O
to	O
align	O
executive	O
reward	O
to	O
shareholders'	O
interests.	O

The	O
Board	O
have	O
considered	O
that	O
it	O
should	O
seek	O
to	O
enhance	O
shareholders'	O
interests	O
by	O
:	O
●	O

having	O
economic	O
profit	O
as	O
a	O
core	O
component	O
of	O
plan	O
design	O
●	O

focusing	O
on	O
sustained	O
growth	O
in	O
shareholder	O
wealth	O
,	O
consisting	O
of	O
dividends	O
and	O
growth	O
in	O
share	O
price	O
,	O
and	O
delivering	O
constant	O
or	O
increasing	O
return	O
on	O
assets	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
focusing	O
the	O
executive	O
on	O
key	O
non-financial	O
drivers	O
of	O
value	O
●	O

attracting	O
and	O
retaining	O
high	O
calibre	O
executives	O
Additionally	O
,	O
the	O
reward	O
framework	O
should	O
seek	O
to	O
enhance	O
executives'	O
interests	O
by	O
:	O
●	O

rewarding	O
capability	O
and	O
experience	O
●	O

reflecting	O
competitive	O
reward	O
for	O
contribution	O
to	O
growth	O
in	O
shareholder	O
wealth	O
●	O

providing	O
a	O
clear	O
structure	O
for	O
earning	O
rewards	O
In	O
accordance	O
with	O
best	O
practice	O
corporate	O
governance	O
,	O
the	O
structure	O
of	O
non-executive	O
director	O
and	O
executive	O
remuneration	O
are	O
separate.	O

Non-executive	O
director	O
remuneration	O
Fees	O
and	O
payments	O
to	O
non-executive	O
directors	O
reflect	O
the	O
demands	O
which	O
are	O
made	O
on	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
responsibilities	O
of	O
,	O
the	O
directors.	O

Non-executive	O
directors'	O
fees	O
and	O
payments	O
are	O
reviewed	O
annually	O
by	O
the	O
Remuneration	O
Committee.	O

The	O
Remuneration	O
Committee	O
has	O
also	O
agreed	O
in	O
the	O
past	O
to	O
the	O
advice	O
of	O
independent	O
remuneration	O
consultants	O
or	O
remuneration	O
publications	O
to	O
ensure	O
non-executive	O
directors'	O
fees	O
and	O
payments	O
are	O
appropriate	O
and	O
in	O
line	O
with	O
the	O
market.	O

The	O
chairman's	O
fees	O
are	O
determined	O
independently	O
to	O
the	O
fees	O
of	O
other	O
non-executive	O
directors	O
based	O
on	O
comparative	O
roles	O
in	O
the	O
external	O
market.	O

The	O
Chairman	O
is	O
not	O
present	O
at	O
any	O
discussions	O
relating	O
to	O
determination	O
of	O
his	O
own	O
remuneration.	O

Non-executive	O
directors	O
did	O
not	O
receive	O
share	O
options	O
or	O
other	O
incentives	O
during	O
the	O
reporting	O
period.	O

ASX	O
listing	O
rules	O
require	O
that	O
the	O
aggregate	O
non-executive	O
director	O
remuneration	O
shall	O
be	O
determined	O
periodically	O
by	O
a	O
general	O
meeting.	O

The	O
most	O
recent	O
determination	O
was	O
at	O
the	O
Annual	O
General	O
Meeting	O
held	O
on	O
20	O
November	O
2018	O
,	O
where	O
the	O
shareholders	O
approved	O
an	O
aggregate	O
remuneration	O
of	O
$500	O
,	O
000.	O

Executive	O
remuneration	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
and	O
company	O
aims	O
to	O
reward	O
executives	O
with	O
a	O
level	O
and	O
mix	O
of	O
remuneration	O
based	O
on	O
their	O
position	O
and	O
responsibility	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
both	O
fixed	O
and	O
variable.	O

The	O
executive	O
remuneration	O
and	O
reward	O
framework	O
has	O
four	O
components	O
:	O
●	O

base	O
pay	O
and	O
non-monetary	O
benefits	O
●	O

short-term	O
performance	O
incentives	O
●	O

share-based	O
payments	O
●	O

other	O
remuneration	O
such	O
as	O
superannuation	O
and	O
long	O
service	O
leave	O
The	O
combination	O
of	O
these	O
comprises	O
the	O
executive's	O
total	O
remuneration.	O

Fixed	O
remuneration	O
,	O
consisting	O
of	O
base	O
salary	O
,	O
superannuation	O
and	O
non-monetary	O
benefits	O
,	O
are	O
reviewed	O
annually	O
by	O
the	O
Remuneration	O
Committee	O
,	O
based	O
on	O
individual	O
and	O
business	O
unit	O
performance	O
,	O
the	O
overall	O
performance	O
of	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
and	O
comparable	O
market	O
remuneration.	O

Executives	O
can	O
receive	O
their	O
fixed	O
remuneration	O
in	O
the	O
form	O
of	O
cash	O
or	O
other	O
fringe	O
benefits	O
(	O
for	O
example	O
motor	O
vehicle	O
benefits	O
)	O
where	O
it	O
does	O
not	O
create	O
any	O
additional	O
cost	O
to	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
and	O
adds	O
additional	O
value	O
to	O
the	O
executive.	O

The	O
short-term	O
incentive	O
(	O
'STI'	O
)	O
program	O
is	O
designed	O
to	O
align	O
the	O
targets	O
of	O
the	O
business	O
units	O
with	O
the	O
targets	O
of	O
those	O
executives	O
in	O
charge	O
of	O
meeting	O
those	O
targets.	O

STI	O
payments	O
are	O
granted	O
to	O
executives	O
based	O
on	O
specific	O
annual	O
targets	O
and	O
key	O
performance	O
indicators	O
(	O
'KPI'	O
)	O
being	O
achieved.	O

KPI	O
’	O
s	O
include	O
profit	O
contribution	O
,	O
customer	O
satisfaction	O
,	O
leadership	O
contribution	O
and	O
exploration	O
management.	O

The	O
long-term	O
incentives	O
(	O
'LTI'	O
)	O
includes	O
long	O
service	O
leave	O
and	O
share-based	O
payments.	O

These	O
include	O
an	O
increase	O
in	O
shareholders'	O
value	O
relative	O
to	O
the	O
entire	O
market	O
and	O
an	O
increase	O
when	O
compared	O
to	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity's	O
direct	O
competitors.	O

16	O
Alliance	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
Directors'	O
report	O
30	O
June	O
2019	O
Consolidated	O
entity	O
performance	O
and	O
link	O
to	O
remuneration	O
The	O
company	O
’	O
s	O
remuneration	O
policy	O
seeks	O
to	O
reward	O
staff	O
members	O
for	O
their	O
contribution	O
to	O
achieving	O
significant	O
milestones	O
but	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
direct	O
link	O
between	O
remuneration	O
paid	O
and	O
growth	O
in	O
the	O
company	O
’	O
s	O
share	O
price	O
or	O
financial	O
performance.	O

Indemnity	O
and	O
insurance	O
of	O
officers	O
The	O
company	O
has	O
indemnified	O
the	O
directors	O
and	O
executives	O
of	O
the	O
company	O
for	O
costs	O
incurred	O
,	O
in	O
their	O
capacity	O
as	O
a	O
director	O
or	O
executive	O
,	O
for	O
which	O
they	O
may	O
be	O
held	O
personally	O
liable	O
,	O
except	O
where	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
lack	O
of	O
good	O
faith.	O

During	O
the	O
financial	O
year	O
,	O
the	O
company	O
paid	O
a	O
premium	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
a	O
contract	O
to	O
insure	O
the	O
directors	O
and	O
executives	O
of	O
the	O
company	O
against	O
a	O
liability	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
permitted	O
by	O
the	O
Corporations	O
Act	O
2001.	O

The	O
contract	O
of	O
insurance	O
prohibits	O
disclosure	O
of	O
the	O
nature	O
of	O
the	O
liability	O
and	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
premium.	O

Corporate	O
Governance	O
Statement	O
In	O

the	O

for	O

of	O

and	O

of	O
good	O

governance.	O

Risk	O
management	O
The	O
company	O
takes	O
a	O
proactive	O
approach	O
to	O
risk	O
management	O
including	O
monitoring	O
actual	O
performance	O
against	O
budgets	O
and	O
forecast	O
and	O
monitoring	O
investment	O
performance.	O

The	O
Board	O
is	O
responsible	O
for	O
ensuring	O
that	O
risks	O
,	O
and	O
also	O
opportunities	O
,	O
are	O
identified	O
on	O
a	O
timely	O
basis	O
and	O
that	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
’	O
s	O
objectives	O
and	O
activities	O
are	O
aligned	O
with	O
the	O
risks	O
and	O
opportunities	O
identified	O
by	O
the	O
Board.	O

2019	O
Note	O
1.	O

Significant	O
accounting	O
policies	O
The	O
principal	O
accounting	O
policies	O
adopted	O
in	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
set	O
out	O
either	O
in	O
the	O
respective	O
notes	O
or	O
below.	O

These	O
policies	O
have	O
been	O
consistently	O
applied	O
to	O
all	O
the	O
years	O
presented	O
,	O
unless	O
otherwise	O
stated.	O

New	O
or	O
amended	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
and	O
Interpretations	O
adopted	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
has	O
adopted	O
all	O
of	O
the	O
new	O
or	O
amended	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
and	O
Interpretations	O
issued	O
by	O
the	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
Board	O
(	O
'AASB'	O
)	O
that	O
are	O
mandatory	O
for	O
the	O
current	O
reporting	O
period.	O

New	O
and	O
amended	O
standards	O
During	O
the	O
financial	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2017	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
early	O
adopted	O
AASB	O
9	O
Financial	O
Instruments	O
as	O
it	O
provided	O
more	O
reliable	O
and	O
relevant	O
information	O
for	O
users	O
to	O
assess	O
the	O
amounts	O
,	O
timing	O
and	O
uncertainty	O
of	O
future	O
cash	O
flows.	O

Basis	O
of	O
preparation	O
These	O
general	O
purpose	O
financial	O
statements	O
have	O
been	O
prepared	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
and	O
Interpretations	O
issued	O
by	O
the	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
Board	O
(	O
'AASB'	O
)	O
and	O
the	O
Corporations	O
Act	O
2001	O
,	O
as	O
appropriate	O
for	O
for-profit	O
oriented	O
entities.	O

These	O
financial	O
statements	O
also	O
comply	O
with	O
International	O
Financial	O
Reporting	O
Standards	O
as	O
issued	O
by	O
the	O
International	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
Board	O
(	O
'IASB'	O
)	O
.	O

Going	O
Concern	O
For	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2019	O
,	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
made	O
a	O
loss	O
after	O
taxation	O
of	O
$1	O
,	O
650	O
,	O
000	O
,	O
had	O
net	O
cash	O
outflows	O
from	O
operating	O
activities	O
of	O
$1	O
,	O
160	O
,	O
000	O
,	O
net	O
cash	O
outflows	O
from	O
investing	O
activities	O
of	O
$4	O
,	O
829	O
,	O
000	O
and	O
net	O
cash	O
inflows	O
of	O
$4	O
,	O
274	O
,	O
000	O
from	O
financing	O
activities.	O

At	O
30	O
June	O
2019	O
,	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
reported	O
cash	O
and	O
cash	O
equivalents	O
of	O
$3	O
,	O
693	O
,	O
000.	O

The	O
directors	O
have	O
prepared	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
on	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
basis	O
,	O
which	O
contemplates	O
the	O
continuity	O
of	O
normal	O
business	O
activity	O
,	O
the	O
realisation	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
the	O
settlement	O
of	O
liabilities	O
through	O
the	O
normal	O
course	O
of	O
business	O
for	O
the	O
following	O
reasons	O
:	O
•	O

The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
has	O
a	O
history	O
of	O
successfully	O
raising	O
funds.	O

As	O
detailed	O
in	O
Note	O
15	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
later	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
year	O
the	O
group	O
successfully	O
raised	O
approximately	O
$4.6	O
million	O
from	O
a	O
non-renounceable	O
entitlement	O
offer.	O

•	O

The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
has	O
prepared	O
a	O
twelve-month	O
cash	O
flow	O
budget	O
which	O
includes	O
additional	O
cash	O
outflows	O
for	O
exploration	O
activity	O
,	O
which	O
can	O
be	O
deferred	O
in	O
part	O
if	O
there	O
are	O
delays	O
in	O
raising	O
capital	O
or	O
insufficient	O
capital	O
is	O
raised	O
to	O
fund	O
forecast	O
expenditure.	O

Should	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
be	O
unable	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
it	O
may	O
be	O
required	O
to	O
realise	O
its	O
assets	O
and	O
discharge	O
its	O
liabilities	O
other	O
than	O
in	O
the	O
normal	O
course	O
of	O
business	O
and	O
at	O
amounts	O
different	O
to	O
those	O
stated	O
in	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O

The	O
financial	O
statements	O
do	O
not	O
include	O
any	O
adjustments	O
relating	O
to	O
the	O
recoverability	O
and	O
classification	O
of	O
asset	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
or	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
liabilities	O
that	O
might	O
be	O
necessarily	O
incurred	O
should	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
be	O
unable	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
and	O
meet	O
its	O
debts	O
as	O
and	O
when	O
they	O
fall	O
due.	O

Historical	O
cost	O
convention	O
The	O
financial	O
statements	O
have	O
been	O
prepared	O
under	O
the	O
historical	O
cost	O
convention	O
,	O
except	O
for	O
,	O
where	O
applicable	O
,	O
the	O
revaluation	O
of	O
financial	O
assets	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income.	O

Critical	O
accounting	O
Estimates	O
The	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
requires	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
certain	O
critical	O
accounting	O
estimates.	O

It	O
also	O
requires	O
management	O
to	O
exercise	O
its	O
judgement	O
in	O
the	O
process	O
of	O
applying	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity's	O
accounting	O
policies.	O

The	O
areas	O
involving	O
a	O
higher	O
degree	O
of	O
judgement	O
or	O
complexity	O
,	O
or	O
areas	O
where	O
assumptions	O
and	O
estimates	O
are	O
significant	O
to	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
,	O
are	O
disclosed	O
in	O
note	O
2.	O

30Alliance	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
Notes	O
to	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
30	O
June	O
2019	O
Note	O
1.	O

Significant	O
accounting	O
policies	O
(	O
continued	O
)	O
Parent	O
entity	O
information	O
In	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
Corporations	O
Act	O
2001	O
,	O
these	O
financial	O
statements	O
present	O
the	O
results	O
of	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
only.	O

Supplementary	O
information	O
about	O
the	O
parent	O
entity	O
is	O
disclosed	O
in	O
note	O
26.	O

Principles	O
of	O
consolidation	O
The	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
statements	O
incorporate	O
the	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
of	O
all	O
subsidiaries	O
of	O
Alliance	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
(	O
'company'	O
or	O
'parent	O
entity'	O
)	O
as	O
at	O
30	O
June	O
2019	O
and	O
the	O
results	O
of	O
all	O
subsidiaries	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
then	O
ended.	O

Alliance	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O
subsidiaries	O
together	O
are	O
referred	O
to	O
in	O
these	O
financial	O
statements	O
as	O
the	O
'consolidated	O
entity'.	O

Subsidiaries	O
are	O
all	O
those	O
entities	O
over	O
which	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
has	O
control.	O

The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
controls	O
an	O
entity	O
when	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
is	O
exposed	O
to	O
,	O
or	O
has	O
rights	O
to	O
,	O
variable	O
returns	O
from	O
its	O
involvement	O
with	O
the	O
entity	O
and	O
has	O
the	O
ability	O
to	O
affect	O
those	O
returns	O
through	O
its	O
power	O
to	O
direct	O
the	O
activities	O
of	O
the	O
entity.	O

Subsidiaries	O
are	O
fully	O
consolidated	O
from	O
the	O
date	O
on	O
which	O
control	O
is	O
transferred	O
to	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity.	O

They	O
are	O
de-consolidated	O
from	O
the	O
date	O
that	O
control	O
ceases.	O

Intercompany	O
transactions	O
,	O
balances	O
and	O
unrealised	O
gains	O
on	O
transactions	O
between	O
entities	O
in	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
are	O
eliminated.	O

Unrealised	O
losses	O
are	O
also	O
eliminated	O
unless	O
the	O
transaction	O
provides	O
evidence	O
of	O
the	O
impairment	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
transferred.	O

Accounting	O
policies	O
of	O
subsidiaries	O
have	O
been	O
changed	O
where	O
necessary	O
to	O
ensure	O
consistency	O
with	O
the	O
policies	O
adopted	O
by	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity.	O

Non-controlling	O
interest	O
in	O
the	O
results	O
and	O
equity	O
of	O
subsidiaries	O
are	O
shown	O
separately	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
and	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
,	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position	O
and	O
statement	O
of	O
changes	O
in	O
equity	O
of	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity.	O

Current	O
and	O
non-current	O
classification	O
Assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
are	O
presented	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position	O
based	O
on	O
current	O
and	O
non-current	O
classification.	O

An	O
asset	O
is	O
classified	O
as	O
current	O
when	O
:	O
it	O
is	O
either	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
realised	O
or	O
intended	O
to	O
be	O
sold	O
or	O
consumed	O
in	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity's	O
normal	O
operating	O
cycle	O
;	O
it	O
is	O
held	O
primarily	O
for	O
the	O
purpose	O
of	O
trading	O
;	O
it	O
is	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
realised	O
within	O
12	O
months	O
after	O
the	O
reporting	O
period	O
;	O
or	O
the	O
asset	O
is	O
cash	O
or	O
cash	O
equivalent	O
unless	O
restricted	O
from	O
being	O
exchanged	O
or	O
used	O
to	O
settle	O
a	O
liability	O
for	O
at	O
least	O
12	O
months	O
after	O
the	O
reporting	O
period.	O

All	O
other	O
assets	O
are	O
classified	O
as	O
non-current.	O

A	O
liability	O
is	O
classified	O
as	O
current	O
when	O
:	O
it	O
is	O
either	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
settled	O
in	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity's	O
normal	O
operating	O
cycle	O
;	O
it	O
is	O
held	O
primarily	O
for	O
the	O
purpose	O
of	O
trading	O
;	O
it	O
is	O
due	O
to	O
be	O
settled	O
within	O
12	O
months	O
after	O
the	O
reporting	O
period	O
;	O
or	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
unconditional	O
right	O
to	O
defer	O
the	O
settlement	O
of	O
the	O
liability	O
for	O
at	O
least	O
12	O
months	O
after	O
the	O
reporting	O
period.	O

All	O
other	O
liabilities	O
are	O
classified	O
as	O
non-current.	O

Rounding	O
of	O
amounts	O
The	O
company	O
is	O
of	O
a	O
kind	O
referred	O
to	O
in	O
Corporations	O
Instrument	O
2016/191	O
,	O
issued	O
by	O
the	O
Australian	O
Securities	O
and	O
Investments	O
Commission	O
,	O
relating	O
to	O
'rounding-off'.	O

Amounts	O
in	O
this	O
report	O
have	O
been	O
rounded	O
off	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
that	O
Corporations	O
Instrument	O
to	O
the	O
nearest	O
thousand	O
dollars	O
(	O
apparent	O
differences	O
may	O
occur	O
due	O
to	O
rounding	O
)	O
,	O
or	O
in	O
certain	O
cases	O
,	O
the	O
nearest	O
dollar.	O

New	O
or	O
amended	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
and	O
Interpretations	O
adopted	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
has	O
adopted	O
all	O
of	O
the	O
new	O
or	O
amended	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
and	O
Interpretations	O
issued	O
by	O
the	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
Board	O
(	O
'AASB'	O
)	O
that	O
are	O
mandatory	O
for	O
the	O
current	O
reporting	O
period.	O

Any	O
new	O
or	O
amended	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
or	O
Interpretations	O
that	O
are	O
not	O
yet	O
mandatory	O
have	O
not	O
been	O
early	O
adopted.	O

The	O
following	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
and	O
Interpretations	O
are	O
most	O
relevant	O
to	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
:	O
AASB	O
15	O
Revenue	O
from	O
Contracts	O
with	O
Customers	O
31Alliance	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
Notes	O
to	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
30	O
June	O
2019	O
Note	O
1.	O

Significant	O
accounting	O
policies	O
(	O
continued	O
)	O
This	O
standard	O
is	O
applicable	O
to	O
annual	O
reporting	O
periods	O
beginning	O
on	O
or	O
after	O
1	O
January	O
2018.	O

The	O
standard	O
provides	O
a	O
single	O
standard	O
for	O
revenue	O
recognition.	O

The	O
core	O
principle	O
of	O
the	O
standard	O
is	O
that	O
an	O
entity	O
will	O
recognise	O
revenue	O
to	O
depict	O
the	O
transfer	O
of	O
promised	O
goods	O
or	O
services	O
to	O
customers	O
in	O
an	O
amount	O
that	O
reflects	O
the	O
consideration	O
to	O
which	O
the	O
entity	O
expects	O
to	O
be	O
entitled	O
in	O
exchange	O
for	O
those	O
goods	O
or	O
services.	O

The	O
standard	O
will	O
require	O
:	O
contracts	O
(	O
either	O
written	O
,	O
verbal	O
or	O
implied	O
)	O
to	O
be	O
identified	O
,	O
together	O
with	O
the	O
separate	O
performance	O
obligations	O
within	O
the	O
contract	O
;	O
determine	O
the	O
transaction	O
price	O
,	O
adjusted	O
for	O
the	O
time	O
value	O
of	O
money	O
excluding	O
credit	O
risk	O
;	O
allocation	O
of	O
the	O
transaction	O
price	O
to	O
the	O
separate	O
performance	O
obligations	O
on	O
a	O
basis	O
of	O
relative	O
stand-alone	O
selling	O
price	O
of	O
each	O
distinct	O
good	O
or	O
service	O
,	O
or	O
estimation	O
approach	O
if	O
no	O
distinct	O
observable	O
prices	O
exist	O
;	O
and	O
recognition	O
of	O
revenue	O
when	O
each	O
performance	O
obligation	O
is	O
satisfied.	O

Credit	O
risk	O
will	O
be	O
presented	O
separately	O
as	O
an	O
expense	O
rather	O
than	O
adjusted	O
to	O
revenue.	O

For	O
goods	O
,	O
the	O
performance	O
obligation	O
would	O
be	O
satisfied	O
when	O
the	O
customer	O
obtains	O
control	O
of	O
the	O
goods.	O

For	O
services	O
,	O
the	O
performance	O
obligation	O
is	O
satisfied	O
when	O
the	O
service	O
has	O
been	O
provided	O
,	O
typically	O
for	O
promises	O
to	O
transfer	O
services	O
to	O
customers.	O

For	O
performance	O
obligations	O
satisfied	O
over	O
time	O
,	O
an	O
entity	O
would	O
select	O
an	O
appropriate	O
measure	O
of	O
progress	O
to	O
determine	O
how	O
much	O
revenue	O
should	O
be	O
recognised	O
as	O
the	O
performance	O
obligation	O
is	O
satisfied.	O

Contracts	O
with	O
customers	O
will	O
be	O
presented	O
in	O
an	O
entity's	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position	O
as	O
a	O
contract	O
liability	O
,	O
a	O
contract	O
asset	O
,	O
or	O
a	O
receivable	O
,	O
depending	O
on	O
the	O
relationship	O
between	O
the	O
entity's	O
performance	O
and	O
the	O
customer's	O
payment.	O

Sufficient	O
quantitative	O
and	O
qualitative	O
disclosure	O
is	O
required	O
to	O
enable	O
users	O
to	O
understand	O
the	O
contracts	O
with	O
customers	O
;	O
the	O
significant	O
judgements	O
made	O
in	O
applying	O
the	O
guidance	O
to	O
those	O
contracts	O
;	O
and	O
any	O
assets	O
recognised	O
from	O
the	O
costs	O
to	O
obtain	O
or	O
fulfil	O
a	O
contract	O
with	O
a	O
customer.	O

The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
adopted	O
this	O
standard	O
from	O
1	O
July	O
2018	O
however	O
,	O
its	O
impact	O
was	O
minimal	O
as	O
the	O
group	O
is	O
an	O
exploration	O
entity	O
with	O
no	O
revenue	O
contracts	O
with	O
external	O
customers.	O

New	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
and	O
Interpretations	O
not	O
yet	O
mandatory	O
or	O
early	O
adopted	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
and	O
Interpretations	O
that	O
have	O
recently	O
been	O
issued	O
or	O
amended	O
but	O
are	O
not	O
yet	O
mandatory	O
,	O
have	O
not	O
been	O
early	O
adopted	O
by	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
for	O
the	O
annual	O
reporting	O
period	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2019.	O

The	O
consolidated	O
entity's	O
assessment	O
of	O
the	O
impact	O
of	O
these	O
new	O
or	O
amended	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
and	O
Interpretations	O
,	O
most	O
relevant	O
to	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
,	O
are	O
set	O
out	O
below.	O

AASB	O
16	O
Leases	O
This	O
standard	O
is	O
applicable	O
to	O
annual	O
reporting	O
periods	O
beginning	O
on	O
or	O
after	O
1	O
January	O
2019.	O

The	O
standard	O
replaces	O
AASB	O
117	O
'Leases'	O
and	O
for	O
lessees	O
will	O
eliminate	O
the	O
classifications	O
of	O
operating	O
leases	O
and	O
finance	O
leases.	O

Subject	O
to	O
exceptions	O
,	O
a	O
'right-of-use'	O
asset	O
will	O
be	O
capitalised	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position	O
,	O
measured	O
at	O
the	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
unavoidable	O
future	O
lease	O
payments	O
to	O
be	O
made	O
over	O
the	O
lease	O
term.	O

The	O
exceptions	O
relate	O
to	O
short-term	O
leases	O
of	O
12	O
months	O
or	O
less	O
and	O
leases	O
of	O
low-value	O
assets	O
(	O
such	O
as	O
personal	O
computers	O
and	O
small	O
office	O
furniture	O
)	O
where	O
an	O
accounting	O
policy	O
choice	O
exists	O
whereby	O
either	O
a	O
'right-of-use'	O
asset	O
is	O
recognised	O
or	O
lease	O
payments	O
are	O
expensed	O
to	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
as	O
incurred.	O

A	O
liability	O
corresponding	O
to	O
the	O
capitalised	O
lease	O
will	O
also	O
be	O
recognised	O
,	O
adjusted	O
for	O
lease	O
prepayments	O
,	O
lease	O
incentives	O
received	O
,	O
initial	O
direct	O
costs	O
incurred	O
and	O
an	O
estimate	O
of	O
any	O
future	O
restoration	O
,	O
removal	O
or	O
dismantling	O
costs.	O

Straight-line	O
operating	O
lease	O
expense	O
recognition	O
will	O
be	O
replaced	O
with	O
a	O
depreciation	O
charge	O
for	O
the	O
leased	O
asset	O
(	O
included	O
in	O
operating	O
costs	O
)	O
and	O
an	O
interest	O
expense	O
on	O
the	O
recognised	O
lease	O
liability	O
(	O
included	O
in	O
finance	O
costs	O
)	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
earlier	O
periods	O
of	O
the	O
lease	O
,	O
the	O
expenses	O
associated	O
with	O
the	O
lease	O
under	O
AASB	O
16	O
will	O
be	O
higher	O
when	O
compared	O
to	O
lease	O
expenses	O
under	O
AASB	O
117.	O

However	O
EBITDA	O
(	O
Earnings	O
Before	O
Interest	O
,	O
Tax	O
,	O
Depreciation	O
and	O
Amortisation	O
)	O
results	O
will	O
be	O
improved	O
as	O
the	O
operating	O
expense	O
is	O
replaced	O
by	O
interest	O
expense	O
and	O
depreciation	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
under	O
AASB	O
16.	O

For	O
classification	O
within	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
cash	O
flows	O
,	O
the	O
lease	O
payments	O
will	O
be	O
separated	O
into	O
both	O
a	O
principal	O
(	O
financing	O
activities	O
)	O
and	O
interest	O
(	O
either	O
operating	O
or	O
financing	O
activities	O
)	O
component.	O

For	O
lessor	O
accounting	O
,	O
the	O
standard	O
does	O
not	O
substantially	O
change	O
how	O
a	O
lessor	O
accounts	O
for	O
leases.	O

The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
will	O
adopt	O
this	O
standard	O
from	O
1	O
July	O
2019	O
but	O
has	O
currently	O
assessed	O
the	O
impact	O
of	O
its	O
adoption	O
to	O
be	O
minimal	O
as	O
there	O
are	O
currently	O
no	O
operating	O
lease	O
transactions	O
that	O
the	O
entity	O
is	O
involved	O
in.	O

32Alliance	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
Notes	O
to	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
30	O
June	O
2019	O
Note	O
2.	O

Critical	O
accounting	O
judgements	O
,	O
estimates	O
and	O
assumptions	O
The	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
requires	O
management	O
to	O
make	O
judgements	O
,	O
estimates	O
and	O
assumptions	O
that	O
affect	O
the	O
reported	O
amounts	O
in	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O

Management	O
continually	O
evaluates	O
its	O
judgements	O
and	O
estimates	O
in	O
relation	O
to	O
assets	O
,	O
liabilities	O
,	O
contingent	O
liabilities	O
,	O
revenue	O
and	O
expenses.	O

Management	O
bases	O
its	O
judgements	O
,	O
estimates	O
and	O
assumptions	O
on	O
historical	O
experience	O
and	O
on	O
other	O
various	O
factors	O
,	O
including	O
expectations	O
of	O
future	O
events	O
,	O
management	O
believes	O
to	O
be	O
reasonable	O
under	O
the	O
circumstances.	O

The	O
resulting	O
accounting	O
judgements	O
and	O
estimates	O
will	O
seldom	O
equal	O
the	O
related	O
actual	O
results.	O

The	O
judgements	O
,	O
estimates	O
and	O
assumptions	O
that	O
have	O
a	O
significant	O
risk	O
of	O
causing	O
a	O
material	O
adjustment	O
to	O
the	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
(	O
refer	O
to	O
the	O
respective	O
notes	O
)	O
within	O
the	O
next	O
financial	O
year	O
are	O
discussed	O
below.	O

Fair	O
value	O
measurement	O
hierarchy	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
is	O
required	O
to	O
classify	O
all	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
,	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
using	O
a	O
three	O
level	O
hierarchy	O
,	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
lowest	O
level	O
of	O
input	O
that	O
is	O
significant	O
to	O
the	O
entire	O
fair	O
value	O
measurement	O
,	O
being	O
:	O
Level	O
1	O
:	O
Quoted	O
prices	O
(	O
unadjusted	O
)	O
in	O
active	O
markets	O
for	O
identical	O
assets	O
or	O
liabilities	O
that	O
the	O
entity	O
can	O
access	O
at	O
the	O
measurement	O
date	O
;	O
Level	O
2	O
:	O
Inputs	O
other	O
than	O
quoted	O
prices	O
included	O
within	O
Level	O
1	O
that	O
are	O
observable	O
for	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
,	O
either	O
directly	O
or	O
indirectly	O
;	O
and	O
Level	O
3	O
:	O
Unobservable	O
inputs	O
for	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
liability.	O

Considerable	O
judgement	O
is	O
required	O
to	O
determine	O
what	O
is	O
significant	O
to	O
fair	O
value	O
and	O
therefore	O
which	O
category	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
is	O
placed	O
in	O
can	O
be	O
subjective.	O

Impairment	O
of	O
non-financial	O
assets	O
other	O
than	O
goodwill	O
and	O
other	O
indefinite	O
life	O
intangible	O
assets	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
assesses	O
impairment	O
of	O
non-financial	O
assets	O
other	O
than	O
goodwill	O
and	O
other	O
indefinite	O
life	O
intangible	O
assets	O
at	O
each	O
reporting	O
date	O
by	O
evaluating	O
conditions	O
specific	O
to	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
and	O
to	O
the	O
particular	O
asset	O
that	O
may	O
lead	O
to	O
impairment.	O

If	O
an	O
impairment	O
trigger	O
exists	O
,	O
the	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
is	O
determined.	O

This	O
involves	O
fair	O
value	O
less	O
costs	O
of	O
disposal	O
or	O
value-in-use	O
calculations	O
,	O
which	O
incorporate	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
key	O
estimates	O
and	O
assumptions.	O

Income	O
tax	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
is	O
subject	O
to	O
income	O
taxes	O
in	O
the	O
jurisdictions	O
in	O
which	O
it	O
operates.	O

Significant	O
judgement	O
is	O
required	O
in	O
determining	O
the	O
provision	O
for	O
income	O
tax.	O

There	O
are	O
many	O
transactions	O
and	O
calculations	O
undertaken	O
during	O
the	O
ordinary	O
course	O
of	O
business	O
for	O
which	O
the	O
ultimate	O
tax	O
determination	O
is	O
uncertain.	O

The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
recognises	O
liabilities	O
for	O
anticipated	O
tax	O
audit	O
issues	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity's	O
current	O
understanding	O
of	O
the	O
tax	O
law.	O

Where	O
the	O
final	O
tax	O
outcome	O
of	O
these	O
matters	O
is	O
different	O
from	O
the	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
,	O
such	O
differences	O
will	O
impact	O
the	O
current	O
and	O
deferred	O
tax	O
provisions	O
in	O
the	O
period	O
in	O
which	O
such	O
determination	O
is	O
made.	O

Note	O
3.	O

Operating	O
segments	O
Identification	O
of	O
reportable	O
operating	O
segments	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
operates	O
in	O
the	O
mineral	O

and	O
mining	O
industry	O
in	O
Australia.	O

The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
has	O
adopted	O
AASB	O
8	O
Operating	O
Segments	O
whereby	O
segment	O
information	O
is	O
presented	O
using	O
a	O
'management	O
approach'.	O

Management	O
has	O
determined	O
the	O
operating	O
segments	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
reports	O
reviewed	O
by	O
the	O
Board	O
of	O
Directors	O
that	O
are	O
used	O
to	O
make	O
strategic	O
decisions.	O

The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
operates	O
predominately	O
in	O
one	O
geographical	O
location.	O

The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
does	O
not	O
have	O
any	O
operating	O
segments	O
with	O
discrete	O
financial	O
information.	O

The	O

does	O
not	O
have	O
any	O
customers	O
,	O
and	O
all	O
the	O

assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
are	O
located	O
within	O
Australia.	O

The	O
Board	O
of	O
Directors	O
review	O
internal	O
management	O
reports	O
on	O
a	O
monthly	O

that	O
is	O
consistent	O
with	O

of	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
and	O
other	O

income	O
,	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O

and	O

As	O
a	O
result	O
no	O

is	O
required	O
because	O
the	O
information	O
as	O
presented	O
is	O
what	O
is	O

of	O

for	O

tax	O
(	O

)	O
Deferred	O
tax	O

of	O

and	O

Previously	O

asset.	O

only	O

assets	O

Tax	O
Consolidation	O
Alliance	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
(	O

)	O

The	O

)	O

$'000	O

)	O
22	O
Deferred	O
tax	O

of	O

differences	O
637	O
808	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
not	O

receivables	O

Note	O
8.	O

Current	O
assets	O
-	O

trade	O
and	O
other	O
receivables	O
(	O
continued	O
)	O
Accounting	O
policy	O
for	O
trade	O
and	O
other	O
receivables	O
Classification	O
as	O
receivables	O
Receivables	O
are	O
recognised	O
initially	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
and	O
then	O
subsequently	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
costs	O
,	O
less	O
provision	O
for	O
expected	O
credit	O
losses.	O

In	O
determining	O
the	O
recoverability	O
of	O
a	O
trade	O
or	O
other	O
receivable	O
using	O
the	O
expected	O
credit	O
loss	O
model	O
,	O
the	O
group	O
performs	O
a	O
risk	O
analysis	O
considering	O
the	O
type	O
and	O
age	O
of	O
the	O
outstanding	O
receivables	O
,	O
the	O
creditworthiness	O
of	O
the	O
counterparty	O
,	O
contract	O
provisions	O
,	O
letter	O
of	O
credit	O
and	O
timing	O
of	O
payment.	O

Fair	O
value	O
of	O
receivables	O
Due	O
to	O
the	O
short-term	O
nature	O
of	O
the	O
current	O
receivables	O
,	O
their	O
carrying	O
amount	O
is	O
assumed	O
to	O
be	O
the	O
same	O
as	O
their	O
fair	O
value.	O

Impairment	O
and	O
risk	O
exposure	O
Information	O
about	O
the	O
impairment	O
of	O
receivables	O
,	O
their	O
credit	O
quality	O
and	O
the	O
group's	O
exposure	O
to	O
credit	O
risk	O
,	O
foreign	O
currency	O
risk	O
and	O
interest	O
rate	O
risk	O
can	O
be	O
found	O
in	O
note	O
20.	O

Accounting	O
policy	O
for	O
Goods	O
and	O
Services	O
Tax	O
(	O
'GST'	O
)	O
and	O
other	O
similar	O
taxes	O
Revenues	O
,	O
expenses	O
and	O
assets	O
are	O
recognised	O
net	O
of	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
associated	O
GST	O
,	O
unless	O
the	O
GST	O
incurred	O
is	O
not	O
recoverable	O
from	O
the	O
tax	O
authority.	O

In	O
this	O
case	O
it	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
the	O
acquisition	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
expense.	O

Receivables	O
and	O
payables	O
are	O
stated	O
inclusive	O
of	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
GST	O
receivable	O
or	O
payable.	O

The	O
net	O
amount	O
of	O
GST	O
recoverable	O
from	O
,	O
or	O
payable	O
to	O
,	O
the	O
tax	O
authority	O
is	O
included	O
in	O
other	O
receivables	O
or	O
other	O
payables	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position.	O

Cash	O
flows	O
are	O
presented	O
on	O
a	O
gross	O
basis.	O

The	O
GST	O
components	O
of	O
cash	O
flows	O
arising	O
from	O
investing	O
or	O
financing	O
activities	O
which	O
are	O
recoverable	O
from	O
,	O
or	O
payable	O
to	O
the	O
tax	O
authority	O
,	O
are	O
presented	O
as	O
operating	O
cash	O
flows.	O

Commitments	O
and	O
contingencies	O
are	O
disclosed	O
net	O
of	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
GST	O
recoverable	O
from	O
,	O
or	O
payable	O
to	O
,	O
the	O
tax	O
authority.	O

:	O

.	O

The	O

on	O

of	O

in	O
Encore	O
Pty	O

on	O
23	O

2006.	O

The	O
CTL	O
shares	O
were	O
obtained	O
on	O
the	O
delisting	O
of	O
Octagonal	O
Resources	O
Ltd	O
(	O
the	O
delisting	O
of	O
Octagonal	O
Resources	O
Ltd	O
(	O
"Octagonal'	O
)	O
on	O
23	O
February	O
2016	O
,	O
at	O
which	O
time	O
Alliance	O
received	O
CTL	O
shares	O
and	O
cash	O
as	O
