for	O
the	O
disposal	O
of	O
its	O
Octagonal	O
shares	O
,	O
and	O
also	O
obtained	O
pursuant	O
to	O
a	O
rights	O
issue	O
in	O
August	O
2016	O
On	O
21	O
March	O
2019	O
Administrators	O
were	O
appointed	O
to	O
CTL	O
and	O
the	O
company	O
subsequently	O
entered	O
into	O
a	O
Deed	O
of	O
Company	O
Arrangement	O
(	O
DOCA	O
)	O
on	O
17	O
May	O
2019	O
As	O
such	O
,	O
CTL	O
shares	O
have	O
been	O
valued	O
at	O
$Nil	O
pending	O
the	O
final	O
outcome	O
of	O
the	O
DOCA.	O

The	O
TYX	O
shares	O
were	O
purchased	O
in	O
September	O
and	O
October	O
2016	O
via	O
on-market	O
purchases	O
and	O
also	O
an	O
off-market	O
purchase.	O

Shares	O
in	O
TYX	O
and	O
SDV	O
are	O
valued	O
by	O
reference	O
to	O
the	O
quoted	O
market	O
price	O
at	O
the	O
close	O
of	O
business	O
on	O
balance	O
date	O
and	O
are	O
classified	O
as	O
financial	O
assets	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income.	O

Accounting	O
policy	O
for	O
financial	O
assets	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
Investments	O
and	O
other	O
financial	O
assets	O
Investments	O
and	O
other	O
financial	O
assets	O
are	O
initially	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value.	O

Transaction	O
costs	O
are	O
included	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
initial	O
measurement.	O

Such	O
assets	O
are	O
subsequently	O
measured	O
at	O
either	O
amortised	O
cost	O
or	O
fair	O
value	O
depending	O
on	O
their	O
classification.	O

Classification	O
is	O
determined	O
based	O
on	O
both	O
the	O
business	O
model	O
within	O
which	O
such	O
assets	O
are	O
held	O
and	O
the	O
contractual	O
cash	O
flow	O
characteristics	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
asset	O
unless	O
,	O
an	O
accounting	O
mismatch	O
is	O
being	O
avoided.	O

Financial	O
assets	O
are	O
derecognised	O
when	O
the	O
rights	O
to	O
receive	O
cash	O
flows	O
have	O
expired	O
or	O
have	O
been	O
transferred	O
and	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
has	O
transferred	O
substantially	O
all	O
the	O
risks	O
and	O
rewards	O
of	O
ownership.	O

When	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
reasonable	O
expectation	O
of	O
recovering	O
part	O
or	O
all	O
of	O
a	O
financial	O
asset	O
,	O
it's	O
carrying	O
value	O
is	O
written	O
off.	O

Financial	O
assets	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
Financial	O
assets	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
include	O
equity	O
investments	O
which	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
i	O
ntends	O
to	O
hold	O
for	O
the	O
foreseeable	O
future	O
and	O
has	O
irrevocably	O
elected	O
to	O
classify	O
them	O
as	O
such	O
upon	O
initial	O
recognition.	O

Impairment	O
of	O
financial	O
assets	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
recognises	O
a	O
loss	O
allowance	O
for	O
expected	O
credit	O
losses	O
on	O
financial	O
assets	O
which	O
are	O
either	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
or	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income.	O

The	O
measurement	O
of	O
the	O
loss	O
allowance	O
depends	O
upon	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity's	O
assessment	O
at	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
each	O
reporting	O
period	O
as	O
to	O
whether	O
the	O
financial	O
instrument's	O
credit	O
risk	O
has	O
increased	O
significantly	O
since	O
initial	O
recognition	O
,	O
based	O
on	O
reasonable	O
and	O
supportable	O
information	O
that	O
is	O
available	O
,	O
without	O
undue	O
cost	O
or	O
effort	O
to	O
obtain.	O

For	O
financial	O
assets	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
,	O
the	O
loss	O
allowance	O
is	O
recognised	O
within	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income.	O

In	O
all	O
other	O
cases	O
,	O
the	O
loss	O
allowance	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

Equity	O
instruments	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
subsequently	O
measures	O
all	O
equity	O
investments	O
at	O
fair	O
value.	O

Where	O
management	O
has	O
elected	O
to	O
present	O
fair	O
value	O
gains	O
and	O
losses	O
on	O
equity	O
investments	O
in	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
,	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
subsequent	O
reclassification	O
of	O
fair	O
value	O
gains	O
and	O
losses	O
to	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

Dividends	O
from	O
such	O
investments	O
continue	O
to	O
be	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
as	O
other	O
income	O
when	O
the	O
company	O
’	O
s	O
right	O
to	O
receive	O
payments	O
is	O
established.	O

Note	O

Accounting	O
policy	O
for	O
property	O
,	O
plant	O
and	O
equipment	O
All	O
classes	O
of	O
property	O
,	O
plant	O
and	O
equipment	O
are	O
stated	O
at	O
cost	O
less	O
accumulated	O
depreciation	O
and	O
any	O
impairment	O
write-	O
downs.	O

Depreciation	O
is	O
calculated	O
on	O
a	O
reducing	O
balance	O
basis	O
to	O
write	O
off	O
the	O
net	O
cost	O
of	O
each	O
item	O
of	O
property	O
,	O
plant	O
and	O
equipment	O
over	O
its	O
expected	O
useful	O
life	O
to	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity.	O

of	O
remaining	O
useful	O
lives	O
are	O
made	O
on	O
a	O
regular	O
basis	O
for	O
all	O
assets.	O

interest	O

$0.00	O
(	O
3	O
)	O
Balance	O
30	O
June	O
2019	O
153	O
,	O
38	O
,	O
332	O
51	O
,	O
815	O
Ordinary	O
shares	O
Ordinary	O
shares	O
entitle	O
the	O
holder	O
to	O
participate	O
in	O
dividends	O
and	O
the	O
proceeds	O
on	O
the	O
winding	O
up	O
of	O
the	O
company	O
in	O
proportion	O
to	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
and	O
amounts	O
paid	O
on	O
the	O
shares	O
held.	O

The	O
fully	O
paid	O
ordinary	O
shares	O
have	O
no	O
par	O
value	O
and	O
the	O
company	O
does	O
not	O
have	O
a	O
limited	O
amount	O
of	O
authorised	O
capital.	O

On	O
a	O
show	O
of	O
hands	O
every	O
member	O
present	O
at	O
a	O
meeting	O
in	O
person	O
or	O
by	O
proxy	O
shall	O
have	O
one	O
vote	O
and	O
upon	O
a	O
poll	O
each	O
share	O
shall	O
have	O
one	O
vote.	O

Share	O
buy-back	O
There	O
is	O
no	O
current	O
on-market	O
share	O
buy-back.	O

Capital	O
risk	O
management	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity's	O
objectives	O
when	O
managing	O
capital	O
are	O
to	O
safeguard	O
its	O
ability	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
,	O
so	O
that	O
it	O
can	O
provide	O
returns	O
for	O
shareholders	O
and	O
benefits	O
for	O
other	O
stakeholders	O
and	O
to	O
maintain	O
an	O
optimum	O
capital	O
structure	O
to	O
reduce	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
capital.	O

Capital	O
is	O
regarded	O
as	O
total	O
equity	O
,	O
as	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position	O
,	O
plus	O
net	O
debt.	O

Net	O
debt	O
is	O
calculated	O
as	O
total	O
borrowings	O
less	O
cash	O
and	O
cash	O
equivalents.	O

In	O
order	O
to	O
maintain	O
or	O
adjust	O
the	O
capital	O
structure	O
,	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
may	O
issue	O
new	O
shares	O
or	O
sell	O
assets	O
to	O
reduce	O
debt.	O

The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
would	O
look	O
to	O

capital	O

current	O

share	O
price	O
at	O

the	O

Note	O
20	O
Financial	O
Instruments	O
Financial	O
risk	O
management	O
objectives	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity's	O
activities	O
expose	O
it	O
to	O
a	O
variety	O
of	O
financial	O
risks	O
:	O
market	O
risk	O
(	O
including	O
foreign	O
currency	O
risk	O
,	O
price	O
risk	O
and	O
interest	O
rate	O
risk	O
)	O
,	O
credit	O
risk	O
and	O
liquidity	O
risk.	O

The	O
consolidated	O
entity's	O
overall	O
risk	O
management	O
program	O
focuses	O
on	O
the	O
unpredictability	O
of	O
financial	O
markets	O
and	O
seeks	O
to	O
minimise	O
potential	O
adverse	O
effects	O
on	O
the	O
financial	O
performance	O
of	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity.	O

The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
uses	O
different	O
methods	O
to	O
measure	O
different	O
types	O
of	O
risk	O
to	O
which	O
it	O
is	O
exposed.	O

These	O
methods	O
include	O
sensitivity	O
analysis	O
in	O
the	O
case	O
of	O
interest	O
rate	O
,	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
and	O
other	O
price	O
risks	O
,	O
ageing	O
analysis	O
for	O
credit	O
risk	O
and	O
beta	O
analysis	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
investment	O
portfolios	O
to	O
determine	O
market	O
risk.	O

Risk	O
management	O
is	O
carried	O
out	O
by	O
senior	O
finance	O
executives	O
(	O
'finance'	O
)	O
under	O
policies	O
approved	O
by	O
the	O
Board	O
of	O
Directors	O
(	O
'the	O
Board'	O
)	O
.	O

These	O
policies	O
include	O
identification	O
and	O
analysis	O
of	O
the	O
risk	O
exposure	O
of	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
and	O
appropriate	O
procedures	O
,	O
controls	O
and	O
risk	O
limits.	O

Finance	O
identifies	O
,	O
evaluates	O
and	O
hedges	O
financial	O
risks	O
within	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity's	O
operating	O
units.	O

Finance	O
reports	O
to	O
the	O
Board	O
on	O
a	O
monthly	O
basis.	O

Market	O
risk	O
Foreign	O
currency	O
risk	O
Foreign	O
exchange	O
risk	O
arises	O
from	O
future	O
commercial	O
transactions	O
and	O
recognised	O
financial	O
assets	O
and	O
financial	O
liabilities	O
denominated	O
in	O
a	O
currency	O
that	O
is	O
not	O
the	O
entity's	O
functional	O
currency.	O

The	O
risk	O
is	O
measured	O
using	O
sensitivity	O
analysis	O
and	O
cash	O
flow	O
forecasting.	O

Resources	O

June	O
2019	O
Note	O
20	O
Financial	O
Instruments	O
(	O
continued	O
)	O
Foreign	O
exchange	O
risk	O
arises	O
from	O
future	O
commitments	O
,	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
that	O
are	O
denominated	O
in	O
a	O
currency	O
that	O
is	O
not	O
the	O
group's	O
functional	O
currency.	O

The	O
group	O
currently	O
operates	O
in	O
Australia	O
only	O
,	O
thus	O
at	O
present	O
it	O
has	O
minimal	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
exposure.	O

The	O
group	O
will	O

have	O
greater	O
exposure	O
in	O
the	O
future	O
as	O
most	O
commodities	O

group	O

for	O
are	O

in	O
US	O
Dollars.	O

Interest	O
rate	O
risk	O
Interest	O
rate	O
risk	O
is	O
the	O
risk	O
that	O
the	O
group's	O
financial	O
position	O
will	O
be	O
adversely	O
affected	O
by	O
movements	O
in	O
interest	O
rates.	O

Interest	O
rate	O
risk	O
on	O
short	O
term	O
deposits	O
is	O
not	O
considered	O
to	O
be	O
a	O
material	O
risk	O
due	O
to	O
the	O
short	O
term	O
nature	O
of	O
these	O
financial	O
instruments.	O

30	O

following	O
cash	O
instruments	O

to	O

rate	O
risk	O
-	O

.	O

Credit	O
risk	O
Credit	O
risk	O
refers	O
to	O
the	O
risk	O
that	O
a	O
counterparty	O
will	O
default	O
on	O
its	O
contractual	O
obligations	O
resulting	O
in	O
financial	O
loss	O
to	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity.	O

The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
has	O
a	O
strict	O
code	O
of	O
credit	O
,	O
including	O
obtaining	O
agency	O
credit	O
information	O
,	O
confirming	O
references	O
and	O
setting	O
appropriate	O
credit	O
limits.	O

The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
obtains	O
guarantees	O
where	O
appropriate	O
to	O
mitigate	O
credit	O
risk.	O

The	O
maximum	O
exposure	O
to	O
credit	O
risk	O
at	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
to	O
recognised	O
financial	O
assets	O
is	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
,	O
net	O
of	O
any	O
provisions	O
for	O
impairment	O
of	O
those	O
assets	O
,	O
as	O
disclosed	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position	O
and	O
notes	O
to	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O

The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
does	O
not	O
hold	O
any	O
collateral.	O

In	O
determining	O
the	O
recoverability	O
of	O
a	O
trade	O
or	O
other	O
receivable	O
using	O
the	O
expected	O
credit	O
loss	O
model	O
,	O
the	O
group	O
performs	O
a	O
risk	O
analysis	O
considering	O
the	O
type	O
and	O
age	O
of	O
the	O
outstanding	O
receivables	O
,	O
the	O
creditworthiness	O
of	O
the	O
counterparty	O
,	O
contract	O
provisions	O
,	O
letter	O
of	O
credit	O
and	O
timing	O
of	O
payment.	O

Liquidity	O
risk	O
Vigilant	O
liquidity	O
risk	O
management	O
requires	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
to	O
maintain	O
sufficient	O
liquid	O
assets	O
(	O
mainly	O
cash	O
and	O
cash	O
equivalents	O
)	O
and	O
available	O
borrowing	O
facilities	O
to	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
pay	O
debts	O
as	O
and	O
when	O
they	O
become	O
due	O
and	O
payable.	O

The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
manages	O
liquidity	O
risk	O
by	O
maintaining	O
adequate	O
cash	O
reserves	O
and	O
available	O
borrowing	O
facilities	O
by	O
continuously	O
monitoring	O
actual	O
and	O

arrangements	O

currently	O
in	O
place.	O

Remaining	O
contractual	O
maturities	O
The	O
following	O
tables	O
detail	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity's	O
remaining	O

maturity	O
for	O
its	O
financial	O
instrument	O
liabilities.	O

tables	O

been	O
drawn	O
up	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
undiscounted	O
cash	O
flows	O
of	O
financial	O
liabilities	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
earliest	O
date	O
on	O
which	O
the	O
financial	O
liabilities	O
are	O
required	O
to	O
be	O
paid.	O

tables	O

and	O

flows	O

as	O

may	O

financial	O

Fair	O
value	O
of	O
financial	O
instruments	O
Unless	O
otherwise	O
stated	O
,	O
the	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
of	O
financial	O
instruments	O
reflect	O
their	O
fair	O
value.	O

The	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
of	O
trade	O
receivables	O
and	O
trade	O
payables	O
are	O
assumed	O
to	O
approximate	O
their	O
fair	O
values	O
due	O
to	O
their	O
short-term	O
nature.	O

The	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
financial	O
liabilities	O
is	O
estimated	O
by	O
discounting	O
the	O
remaining	O
contractual	O
maturities	O
at	O
the	O
current	O
market	O
interest	O
rate	O
that	O
is	O
available	O
for	O
similar	O
financial	O
instruments.	O

Note	O
21	O
Fair	O
Value	O
Measurement	O
Fair	O
value	O
hierarchy	O
The	O
following	O
tables	O
detail	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity's	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
,	O
measured	O
or	O
disclosed	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
using	O
a	O
three	O
level	O
hierarchy	O
,	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
lowest	O
level	O
of	O
input	O
that	O
is	O
significant	O
to	O
the	O
entire	O
fair	O
value	O
measurement	O
,	O
being	O
:	O
Level	O
1	O
:	O
Quoted	O
prices	O
(	O
unadjusted	O
)	O
in	O
active	O
markets	O
for	O
identical	O
assets	O
or	O
liabilities	O
that	O
the	O
entity	O
can	O
access	O
at	O
the	O
measurement	O
date	O
Level	O
2	O
:	O
Inputs	O
other	O
than	O
quoted	O
prices	O
included	O
within	O
Level	O
1	O
that	O
are	O
observable	O
for	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
,	O
either	O
directly	O
or	O
indirectly	O
Level	O
3	O
:	O
Unobservable	O
inputs	O
for	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
Level	O
1	O
Level	O
2	O
Level	O
3	O
Total	O
Consolidated	O
-	O

2019	O
$'000	O
$'000	O
$'000	O
$'000	O

shares	O

Accounting	O
policy	O
for	O
fair	O
value	O
measurement	O
When	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
,	O
financial	O
or	O
non-financial	O
,	O
is	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
for	O
recognition	O
or	O
disclosure	O
purposes	O
,	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
price	O
that	O
would	O
be	O
received	O
to	O
sell	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
paid	O
to	O
transfer	O
a	O
liability	O
in	O
an	O
orderly	O
transaction	O
between	O
market	O
participants	O
at	O
the	O
measurement	O
date	O
;	O
and	O
assumes	O
that	O
the	O
transaction	O
will	O
take	O
place	O
either	O
:	O
in	O
the	O
principal	O
market	O
;	O
or	O
in	O
the	O
absence	O
of	O
a	O
principal	O
market	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
most	O
advantageous	O
market.	O

47	O
Alliance	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
Notes	O
to	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
30	O
June	O
2019	O
Note	O
21	O
Fair	O
Value	O
Measurement	O
(	O
continued	O
)	O
Fair	O
value	O
is	O
measured	O
using	O
the	O
assumptions	O
that	O
market	O
participants	O
would	O
use	O
when	O
pricing	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
,	O
assuming	O
they	O
act	O
in	O
their	O
economic	O
best	O
interests.	O

Valuation	O
techniques	O
that	O
are	O
appropriate	O
in	O
the	O
circumstances	O
and	O
for	O
which	O
sufficient	O
data	O
is	O
available	O
to	O
measure	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
are	O
used	O
,	O
maximising	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
relevant	O
observable	O
inputs	O
and	O
minimising	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
unobservable	O
inputs.	O

Assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
are	O
classified	O
into	O
three	O
levels	O
,	O
using	O
a	O
fair	O
value	O
hierarchy	O
that	O
reflects	O
the	O
significance	O
of	O
the	O
inputs	O
used	O
in	O
making	O
the	O
measurements.	O

Classifications	O
are	O
reviewed	O
at	O
each	O
reporting	O
date	O
and	O
transfers	O
between	O
levels	O
are	O
determined	O
based	O
on	O
a	O
reassessment	O
of	O
the	O
lowest	O
level	O
of	O
input	O
that	O
is	O
significant	O
to	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
measurement.	O

837	O
20/06/2019	O
31/01/2025	O
$0.09	O
$0.24	O
70.00%	O
-	O

2.00%	O
$1	O
,	O
946	O
Accounting	O
policy	O
for	O
share-based	O
payments	O
Equity-settled	O
transactions	O
are	O
awards	O
of	O
shares	O
,	O
or	O
options	O
over	O
shares	O
,	O
that	O
are	O
provided	O
to	O
employees	O
in	O
exchange	O
for	O
the	O
rendering	O
of	O
services.	O

Cash-settled	O
transactions	O
are	O
awards	O
of	O
cash	O
for	O
the	O
exchange	O
of	O
services	O
,	O
where	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
cash	O
is	O
determined	O
by	O
reference	O
to	O
the	O
share	O
price.	O

The	O
cost	O
of	O
equity-settled	O
transactions	O
are	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
on	O
grant	O
date.	O

Fair	O
value	O
is	O
independently	O
determined	O
using	O
either	O
the	O
Binomial	O
or	O
Black-Scholes	O
option	O
pricing	O
model	O
that	O
takes	O
into	O
account	O
the	O
exercise	O
price	O
,	O
the	O
term	O
of	O
the	O
option	O
,	O
the	O
impact	O
of	O
dilution	O
,	O
the	O
share	O
price	O
at	O
grant	O
date	O
and	O
expected	O
price	O
volatility	O
of	O
the	O
underlying	O
share	O
,	O
the	O
expected	O
dividend	O
yield	O
and	O
the	O
risk	O
free	O
interest	O
rate	O
for	O
the	O
term	O
of	O
the	O
option	O
,	O
together	O
with	O
non-vesting	O
conditions	O
that	O
do	O
not	O
determine	O
whether	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
receives	O
the	O
services	O
that	O
entitle	O
the	O
employees	O
to	O
receive	O
payment.	O

No	O
account	O
is	O
taken	O
of	O
any	O
other	O
vesting	O
conditions.	O

The	O
cost	O
of	O
equity-settled	O
transactions	O
are	O
recognised	O
as	O
an	O
expense	O
with	O
a	O
corresponding	O
increase	O
in	O
equity	O
over	O
the	O
vesting	O
period.	O

The	O
cumulative	O
charge	O
to	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
is	O
calculated	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
grant	O
date	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
award	O
,	O
the	O
best	O
estimate	O
of	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
awards	O
that	O
are	O
likely	O
to	O
vest	O
and	O
the	O
expired	O
portion	O
of	O
the	O
vesting	O
period.	O

The	O
amount	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
for	O
the	O
period	O
is	O
the	O
cumulative	O
amount	O
calculated	O
at	O
each	O
reporting	O
date	O
less	O
amounts	O
already	O
recognised	O
in	O
previous	O
periods.	O

The	O
cost	O
of	O
cash-settled	O
transactions	O
is	O
initially	O
,	O
and	O
at	O
each	O
reporting	O
date	O
until	O
vested	O
,	O
determined	O
by	O
applying	O
either	O
the	O
Binomial	O
or	O
Black-Scholes	O
option	O
pricing	O
model	O
,	O
taking	O
into	O
consideration	O
the	O
terms	O
and	O
conditions	O
on	O
which	O
the	O
award	O
was	O
granted.	O

The	O
cumulative	O
charge	O
to	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
until	O
settlement	O
of	O
the	O
liability	O
is	O
calculated	O
as	O
follows	O
:	O
●	O

during	O
the	O
vesting	O
period	O
,	O
the	O
liability	O
at	O
each	O
reporting	O
date	O
is	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
award	O
at	O
that	O
date	O
multiplied	O
by	O
the	O
expired	O
portion	O
of	O
the	O
vesting	O
period.	O

●	O

from	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
the	O
vesting	O
period	O
until	O
settlement	O
of	O
the	O
award	O
,	O
the	O
liability	O
is	O
the	O
full	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
liability	O
at	O
the	O
reporting	O
date.	O

All	O
changes	O
in	O
the	O
liability	O
are	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

The	O
ultimate	O
cost	O
of	O
cash-settled	O
transactions	O
is	O
the	O
cash	O
paid	O
to	O
settle	O
the	O
liability.	O

55Alliance	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
Notes	O
to	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
30	O
June	O
2019	O
Note	O
31	O
Share-Based	O
Payments	O
(	O
continued	O
)	O
Market	O
conditions	O
are	O
taken	O
into	O
consideration	O
in	O
determining	O
fair	O
value.	O

Therefore	O
any	O
awards	O
subject	O
to	O
market	O
conditions	O
are	O
considered	O
to	O
vest	O
irrespective	O
of	O
whether	O
or	O
not	O
that	O
market	O
condition	O
has	O
been	O
met	O
,	O
provided	O
all	O
other	O
conditions	O
are	O
satisfied.	O

If	O
equity-settled	O
awards	O
are	O
modified	O
,	O
as	O
a	O
minimum	O
an	O
expense	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O
if	O
the	O
modification	O
has	O
not	O
been	O
made.	O

An	O
additional	O
expense	O
is	O
recognised	O
,	O
over	O
the	O
remaining	O
vesting	O
period	O
,	O
for	O
any	O
modification	O
that	O
increases	O
the	O
total	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
share-based	O
compensation	O
benefit	O
as	O
at	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
modification.	O

If	O
the	O
non-vesting	O
condition	O
is	O
within	O
the	O
control	O
of	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
or	O
employee	O
,	O
the	O
failure	O
to	O
satisfy	O
the	O
condition	O
is	O
treated	O
as	O
a	O
cancellation.	O

If	O
the	O
condition	O
is	O
not	O
within	O
the	O
control	O
of	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
or	O
employee	O
and	O
is	O
not	O
satisfied	O
during	O
the	O
vesting	O
period	O
,	O
any	O
remaining	O
expense	O
for	O
the	O
award	O
is	O
recognised	O
over	O
the	O
remaining	O
vesting	O
period	O
,	O
unless	O
the	O
award	O
is	O
forfeited.	O

If	O
equity-settled	O
awards	O
are	O
cancelled	O
,	O
it	O
is	O
treated	O
as	O
if	O
it	O
has	O
vested	O
on	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
cancellation	O
,	O
and	O
any	O
remaining	O
expense	O
is	O
recognised	O
immediately.	O

If	O
a	O
new	O
replacement	O
award	O
is	O
substituted	O
for	O
the	O
cancelled	O
award	O
,	O
the	O
cancelled	O
and	O
new	O
award	O
is	O
treated	O
as	O
if	O
they	O
were	O
a	O
modification.	O

Note	O
32	O
Contingent	O
Liabilities	O
(	O
Group	O
)	O
The	O
group	O
had	O
no	O
contingent	O
liabilities	O
as	O
at	O
30	O
June	O

:	O
$Nil	O
)	O

●	O

,	O

2001	O
and	O

professional	O
reporting	O
requirements	O
;	O
●	O

the	O
attached	O
financial	O
statements	O
and	O

comply	O
with	O

Financial	O
Reporting	O
Standards	O
as	O

as	O

●	O

Report	O

a	O
TRUE	O

view	O

Australian	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
and	O
the	O
Corporations	O
Act	O
2001	O
and	O
for	O
such	O
internal	O
control	O
as	O
the	O
directors	O
determine	O
is	O
necessary	O
to	O
enable	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
that	O
gives	O
a	O
TRUE	O
and	O
fair	O
view	O
and	O
is	O
free	O
from	O
material	O
misstatement	O
,	O
whether	O
due	O
to	O
fraud	O
or	O
error.	O

In	O
preparing	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
,	O
the	O
directors	O
are	O
responsible	O
for	O
assessing	O
the	O
ability	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
,	O
disclosing	O
,	O
as	O
applicable	O
,	O
matters	O
related	O
to	O
going	O
concern	O
and	O
using	O
the	O
going	O
concern	O
basis	O
of	O
accounting	O
unless	O
the	O
directors	O
either	O
intend	O
to	O

the	O
Group	O
or	O
to	O
cease	O
operations	O
,	O

no	O

but	O
to	O
do	O
so.	O

Auditor	O
’	O
s	O
responsibilities	O
for	O
the	O
audit	O
of	O
the	O
Financial	O
Report	O
Our	O
objectives	O
are	O
to	O
obtain	O
reasonable	O
assurance	O
about	O
whether	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
as	O
a	O
whole	O
is	O
free	O
from	O
material	O
misstatement	O
,	O
whether	O
due	O
to	O
fraud	O
or	O
error	O
,	O
and	O
to	O
issue	O
an	O
auditor	O
’	O
s	O
report	O
that	O
includes	O
our	O
opinion.	O

Reasonable	O
assurance	O
is	O
a	O
high	O
level	O
of	O
assurance	O
,	O
but	O
is	O
not	O
a	O
guarantee	O
that	O
an	O
audit	O
conducted	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
Australian	O
Auditing	O
Standards	O
will	O
always	O
detect	O
a	O
material	O
misstatement	O
when	O
it	O
exists.	O

Misstatements	O
can	O
arise	O
from	O
fraud	O
or	O
error	O
and	O
are	O
considered	O
material	O
if	O
,	O
individually	O
or	O
in	O
the	O
aggregate	O
,	O
they	O
could	O
reasonably	O
be	O
expected	O
to	O
influence	O
the	O
economic	O
decisions	O
of	O
users	O
taken	O
on	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
this	O
financial	O
report.	O

Puhipuhi	O
Evolution	O
acquired	O
100%	O
of	O
the	O
Puhipuhi	O
project	O
in	O
May	O
2015	O
which	O
covers	O
81km2	O
in	O
the	O
Northland	O
region	O
of	O
the	O
North	O
Island	O
of	O
New	O
Zealand.	O

We	O
believe	O
this	O
region	O
is	O
highly	O
prospective	O
for	O
high-grade	O
,	O
low-sulphidation	O
,	O
epithermal	O
gold	O
and	O
silver	O
mineralisation.	O

Very	O
limited	O
exploration	O
utilising	O
modern	O
techniques	O
and	O
models	O
has	O
been	O
deployed	O
in	O
the	O
region	O
since	O
the	O
1980s.	O

Since	O
acquiring	O
the	O
project	O
we	O
have	O
undertaken	O
extensive	O
geophysics	O
,	O
stakeholder	O
engagement	O
and	O
completed	O
a	O
comprehensive	O
baseline	O
environmental	O
study	O
in	O
preparation	O
for	O
drilling.	O

Previous	O
work	O
has	O
identi	O
ﬁ	O

ed	O
path	O
ﬁ	O

nder	O
geochemical	O
anomalies	O
in	O
soils	O
which	O
indicate	O
a	O
presence	O
of	O
a	O
hydrothermal	O
system	O
potentially	O
capable	O
of	O
producing	O
gold	O
and	O
silver	O
mineralisation.	O

Within	O
this	O
area	O
rock	O
chips	O
and	O
limited	O
(	O
mostly	O
)	O
shallow	O
drilling	O
have	O
returned	O
a	O
handful	O
of	O
high-grade	O
gold	O
assays.	O

Our	O
geology	O
model	O
indicates	O
that	O
at	O
surface	O
we	O
are	O
seeing	O
high	O
levels	O
of	O
the	O
epithermal	O
system	O
preserved.	O

The	O
gold	O
rich	O
parts	O
,	O
if	O
present	O
,	O
are	O
likely	O
to	O
be	O
preserved	O
deeper	O
in	O
the	O
hydrothermal	O
system.	O

Realising	O
that	O
target	O
depths	O
may	O
be	O
between	O
200	O
and	O
600m	O
below	O
surface	O
we	O
undertook	O
in	O
excess	O
of	O
36	O
line	O
km	O
of	O
CSAMT	O
,	O
(	O
controlled	O
source	O
audio	O
frequency	O
magneto	O
telluric	O
)	O
surveys.	O

This	O
technique	O
maps	O
areas	O
of	O
resistive	O
and	O
conductive	O
rocks	O
in	O
the	O
subsurface.	O

Resistors	O
relate	O
to	O
zones	O
of	O
silici	O
ﬁ	O

cation	O
and	O
potentially	O
quartz	O
veins	O
whereas	O
conductors	O
may	O
indicate	O
areas	O
of	O
clay	O
alteration	O
associated	O
with	O
this	O
mineralisation	O
style.	O

Drilling	O
at	O
the	O
Puhipuhi	O
project	O
commenced	O
in	O
June	O
2016	O
to	O
test	O
CSAMT	O

Venn	O
North	O
tenement	O
(	O
E36/2680	O

was	O
granted	O
(	O
Figure	O
2	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
Mt	O
Venn	O
North	O
tenement	O
covers	O
the	O
entire	O
northern	O

of	O
the	O

Venn	O

drilling	O
along	O
this	O
trend	O
,	O
intersected	O
anomalous	O
areas	O

several	O

wide	O
zones	O

20-44m	O

of	O
copper	O

almost	O

greater	O
than	O
0.2%	O

1	O
,	O
900m	O

Exploration	O
Target	O
The	O
Company	O
has	O
engaged	O
well-credentialled	O
resource	O
consulting	O
group	O
Entech	O
to	O
define	O
an	O
initial	O
Exploration	O
Target	O
at	O
Mt	O
Venn	O
in	O
line	O
with	O
the	O
JORC	O
Code	O
(	O
2012	O
)	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
JORC	O
Code	O
an	O
Exploration	O
Target	O
is	O
defined	O
as	O
:	O
“	O
…	O

a	O
statement	O
or	O
estimate	O
of	O
the	O
exploration	O
potential	O
of	O
a	O
mineral	O
deposit	O
in	O
a	O
defined	O
geological	O
setting	O
where	O
the	O
statement	O
or	O
estimate	O
,	O
quoted	O
as	O
a	O
range	O
of	O
tonnes	O
and	O
a	O
range	O
of	O
grade	O
(	O
or	O
quality	O
)	O
,	O
relates	O
to	O
mineralisation	O
for	O
which	O
there	O
has	O
been	O
insufficient	O
exploration	O
to	O
estimate	O
a	O
Mineral	O
Resource.	O

”	O
The	O
definition	O
of	O
this	O
Exploration	O
Target	O
,	O
planned	O
for	O
completion	O
in	O
the	O
June	O
quarter	O
,	O
will	O
be	O
fundamental	O
to	O
planning	O
further	O
drilling	O
required	O
to	O
upgrade	O
Mt	O
Venn	O
to	O
a	O
JORC	O
compliant	O
resource	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
testing	O
the	O
mineralisation	O
potential	O
beyond	O
the	O
current	O
drilling	O
limits.	O

About	O
Cosmo	O
Metals	O
Ltd	O
Cosmo	O
Metals	O
Ltd	O
(	O
Cosmo	O
;	O
ASX	O
:	O
CMO	O
)	O
is	O
an	O
ASX-listed	O
,	O
base	O
metals	O
exploration	O
company	O
focused	O
on	O
the	O
advancement	O
of	O
its	O
flagship	O
Mt	O
Venn	O
,	O
Winchester	O
and	O
Eastern	O
Mafic	O
projects	O
in	O
the	O
underexplored	O
Yamarna	O
Belt	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
Eastern	O
Goldfields	O
region	O
of	O
Western	O
Australia.	O

The	O
Yamarna	O
Belt	O
is	O
considered	O
highly	O
prospective	O
for	O
copper-nickel-cobalt	O
(	O
Cu-Ni-Co	O
)	O
and	O
platinum	O
group	O
elements	O
(	O
PGE	O
)	O
and	O
Cosmo	O
’	O
s	O
well	O
regarded	O
technical	O
team	O
is	O
advancing	O
exploration	O
on	O
multiple	O
fronts	O
to	O
unlock	O
the	O
potential	O
of	O
the	O
region.	O

With	O
previous	O
drilling	O
having	O
identified	O
sulphide	O
Cu-Ni-	O
Co	O
mineralisation	O
at	O
Cosmo	O
’	O
s	O
key	O
projects	O
,	O
the	O
company	O
has	O
a	O
unique	O
opportunity	O
to	O
add	O
value	O
from	O
this	O
460km2	O
landholding	O
Competent	O
Persons	O
Statement	O
The	O
information	O
in	O
this	O
report	O
that	O
relates	O
to	O
Exploration	O
Results	O
is	O
based	O
upon	O
and	O
fairly	O
represents	O
information	O
compiled	O
by	O
Mr	O
James	O
Merrillees	O
,	O
a	O
Competent	O
Person	O
who	O
is	O
a	O
Member	O
of	O
the	O
Australasian	O
Institute	O
of	O
Mining	O
and	O
Metallurgy.	O

Mr	O
Merrillees	O
is	O
a	O
full-time	O
employee	O
of	O
the	O
Company.	O

Mr	O
Merrillees	O
has	O
sufficient	O
experience	O
that	O
is	O
relevant	O
to	O
the	O
style	O
of	O
mineralisation	O
and	O
type	O
of	O
deposit	O
under	O
consideration	O
and	O
to	O
the	O
activity	O
being	O
undertaken	O
to	O
qualify	O
as	O
a	O
Competent	O
Person	O
as	O
defined	O
in	O
the	O
2012	O
Edition	O
of	O
the	O
‘	O
Australian	O
Code	O
for	O
Reporting	O
of	O
Exploration	O
Results	O
,	O
Mineral	O
Resources	O
and	O
Ore	O
Reserves	O
’	O
.	O

Mr	O
Merrillees	O
consents	O
to	O
the	O
inclusion	O
in	O
the	O
report	O
of	O
the	O
matter	O
based	O
on	O
his	O
information	O
in	O
the	O
form	O
and	O
context	O
in	O
which	O
it	O
appears.	O

Forward-Looking	O
Statements	O
This	O
document	O
may	O
include	O
forward-looking	O
statements.	O

Forward-looking	O
statements	O
include	O
,	O
but	O
are	O
not	O
limited	O
to	O
,	O
statements	O
concerning	O
Cosmo	O
’	O
s	O
planned	O
exploration	O
program	O
and	O
other	O
statements	O
that	O
are	O
not	O
historical	O
facts.	O

When	O
used	O
in	O
this	O
document	O
,	O
the	O
words	O
such	O
as	O
"could	O
,	O
"	O
"plan	O
,	O
"	O
"estimate	O
,	O
"	O
"expect	O
,	O
"	O
"intend	O
,	O
"	O
"may	O
”	O
,	O
"potential	O
,	O
"	O
"should	O
,	O
"	O
and	O
similar	O
expressions	O
are	O
forward-looking	O
statements.	O

Although	O
Cosmo	O
believes	O
that	O
its	O
expectations	O
reflected	O
in	O
these	O
forward-looking	O
statements	O
are	O
reasonable	O
,	O
such	O
statements	O
involve	O
risks	O
and	O
uncertainties	O
and	O
no	O
assurance	O
can	O
be	O
given	O
that	O
actual	O
results	O
will	O
be	O
consistent	O
with	O
these	O
forward-looking	O
statements.	O

1.	O

–	O

Eyre	O

,	O
South	O
Australia	O
A	O
detailed	O
review	O
of	O
historical	O
data	O
,	O
from	O
aircore	O
drilling	O
undertaken	O
by	O
Adelaide	O
Exploration	O
Pty	O
Ltd	O
in	O
2007	O
,	O
identified	O
thick	O
intervals	O
,	O
up	O
to	O
24m	O
,	O
of	O
high	O
purity	O
kaolin	O
clay	O
,	O
over	O
an	O
area	O
of	O
approximately	O
1	O
km	O
x	O
1km	O
(	O
Fig.	O

2	O
)	O
.	O

the	O
41	O
aircore	O
holes	O
drilled	O
,	O
a	O
preliminary	O
10	O
holes	O
were	O
sub-sampled	O
to	O
assess	O
the	O
potential	O
for	O
high	O
purity	O
kaolin	O
and	O
ion	O
adsorption	O
clay	O
(	O
IAC	O
)	O
REE	O
mineralisation.	O

The	O
results	O
were	O
successful	O
and	O
show	O
thick	O
intervals	O
of	O
high	O
purity	O
kaolin	O
at	O
or	O
near	O
surface	O
with	O
coincident	O
total	O
rare	O
earth	O
element	O
oxides	O

of	O

is	O

a	O
thick	O

on	O

cerium	O
values.	O

of	O
33m	O
@	O
356	O
ppm	O
Ce	O
from	O
surface.	O

is	O
over	O
three	O
times	O
the	O
Ce	O
concentration	O
in	O
the	O
best	O

over	O
a	O

interval.	O

Next	O

is	O
now	O
undertaking	O
the	O
kaolin	O
beneficiation	O
process	O
on	O
selected	O

from	O

13	O
drill	O
holes.	O

In	O
previous	O
samples	O
the	O
REE	O
’	O
s	O
have	O
been	O
significantly	O
concentrated	O
in	O
the	O
clay	O
component	O
,	O
upgrading	O
the	O
REE	O
grade	O
on	O
average	O
184%.	O

This	O
confirms	O
that	O
the	O
REE	O
’	O
s	O
are	O
bound	O
to	O
the	O
clay	O
particles	O
,	O
and	O
with	O
the	O
heavy	O
rare	O
earth	O
element	O
and	O
neodymium	O
and	O
praseodymium	O
enrichment	O
,	O
this	O
is	O
possibly	O
an	O
ion	O
adsorption	O
clay	O
style	O
of	O
REE	O
mineralisation.	O

Samples	O
are	O
being	O
sent	O
to	O
ANSTO	O
in	O
Sydney	O
to	O
understand	O
the	O
REE	O
recoveries	O
and	O
what	O
proportion	O
might	O
be	O
ionically	O
attached	O
to	O
clays	O
and	O
therefore	O
readily	O
recoverable.	O

ABOUT	O
iTECH	O
MINERALS	O
LTD	O
iTech	O
Minerals	O
Ltd	O
is	O
a	O
newly	O
listed	O
mineral	O
exploration	O
company	O
exploring	O
for	O
and	O
developing	O
battery	O
materials	O
and	O
critical	O
minerals	O
within	O
its	O
100%	O
owned	O
Australian	O
projects.	O

The	O
company	O
is	O
exploring	O
for	O
kaolinite-halloysite	O
,	O
ion	O
adsorption	O
clay	O
rare	O
earth	O
element	O
mineralisation	O
and	O
developing	O
the	O
Campoona	O
Graphite	O
Deposit	O
in	O
South	O
Australia.	O

The	O
company	O
also	O
has	O
extensive	O
exploration	O
tenure	O
prospective	O
for	O
Cu-Au	O
porphyry	O
mineralisation	O
,	O
IOCG	O
mineralisation	O
and	O
gold	O
mineralisation	O
in	O
South	O
Australia	O
and	O
tin	O
,	O
Tungsten	O
,	O
and	O
polymetallic	O
Cobar	O
style	O
mineralisation	O
in	O
New	O
South	O
Wales.	O

PERSON	O
STATEMENT	O
The	O

to	O

and	O

Mr	O

is	O

to	O

GLOSSARY	O
CREO	O
=	O
Critical	O
Rare	O
Earth	O
Element	O
Oxide	O
HREO	O
=	O
Heavy	O
Rare	O
Earth	O
Element	O
Oxide	O
IAC	O
=	O
Ion	O
Adsorption	O
Clay	O

=	O
Light	O
Rare	O
Earth	O
Element	O
Oxide	O
REE	O
=	O
Rare	O
Earth	O
Element	O
REO	O
=	O
Rare	O
Earth	O
Element	O
Oxide	O
TREO	O
=	O
Total	O
Rare	O
Earth	O
Element	O
Oxides	O
%NdPr	O
=	O
Percentage	O
amount	O
of	O
neodymium	O
and	O
praesidium	O
as	O
a	O
proportion	O
of	O
the	O
total	O
amount	O
of	O
rare	O
earth	O
elements	O

your	O

the	O

the	O

’	O
s	O
portfolio.	O

To	O
this	O
endeavour	O
we	O
instigated	O
an	O
IP	O
survey	O
over	O
a	O
portion	O
of	O
the	O
Hodrusa-Hamre	O
exploration	O
licence	O
–	O

the	O
first	O
modern	O
,	O
large	O
scale	O
geophysical	O
survey	O
ever	O
carried	O
out	O
over	O
the	O
Stiavnica	O
caldera	O
,	O
the	O
biggest	O
mineralised	O
centre	O
of	O
central	O
Slovakia	O
and	O
,	O
with	O
the	O
exception	O
of	O
an	O
operating	O
mine	O
within	O
our	O
tenement	O
,	O
entirely	O
held	O
by	O
Prospech.	O

The	O
IP	O
survey	O
resulted	O
in	O
the	O
delineation	O
of	O
several	O
anomalies	O
supportive	O
of	O
the	O
detachment	O
fault	O
(	O
LANF	O
)	O
concept	O
,	O
providing	O
a	O
fresh	O
perspective	O
and	O
new	O
tool	O
to	O
facilitate	O
the	O
discovery	O
of	O
gold	O
and	O
silver	O
deposits	O
within	O
the	O
Hodrusa-Hamre	O
licence	O
area.	O

A	O
drill	O
program	O
has	O
already	O
been	O
designed	O
and	O
permitted	O
to	O
test	O
these	O
anomalies	O
during	O
the	O
2022	O
field	O
and	O
drilling	O
season.	O

Further	O
,	O
an	O
airborne	O
drone	O
magnetic	O
survey	O
has	O
been	O
carried	O
out	O
over	O
the	O
Zemplin	O
prospect	O
within	O
the	O
Cejkov-Zemplin	O
tenement	O
and	O
is	O
currently	O
being	O
drill	O
tested.	O

Assay	O
results	O
will	O
follow	O
with	O
interest.	O

Despite	O
the	O
COVID-19	O
interrupted	O
past	O
year	O
,	O
the	O
outlook	O
is	O
interesting	O
with	O

drilling	O
on	O
our	O
tenements.	O

To	O
this	O
end	O
,	O
our	O
geologic	O
crew	O
have	O
over	O
sixty	O
drill	O
sites	O
permitted	O
and	O
scheduled	O
to	O
be	O
drilled	O
during	O
the	O
current	O
northern	O
hemisphere	O
summer.	O

Hodrusa-Hamre	O
Exploration	O
Licence	O

200	O

east	O
of	O
Vienna	O
,	O

Hodrusa-Hamre	O
exploration	O
licence	O
is	O
approximately	O
102	O
km2	O
in	O
area	O
and	O
covers	O
the	O
majority	O
of	O
the	O
Neogene	O
Stiavnica	O
Stratovolcano	O
caldera	O
within	O
the	O
Central	O
Slovakian	O
Volcanic	O
Belt	O
and	O
includes	O
the	O
historic	O
Hodrusa-Hamre/Banska	O
Stiavnica	O
mining	O
district.	O

The	O
exploration	O
licence	O
encompasses	O
some	O
120	O
gold-silver-bearing	O
epithermal	O
veins	O
with	O
the	O
major	O
veins	O
individually	O
reaching	O
a	O
length	O
of	O
up	O
to	O
6	O
kilometres.	O

Drilling	O
During	O
the	O
year	O
,	O
Company	O
drilled	O
the	O
Anton	O
prospect	O
,	O
where	O
past	O
records	O
report	O
mining	O
to	O
a	O
depth	O
of	O
over	O
500	O
metres	O
below	O
surface.	O

This	O
has	O
been	O
the	O
first	O
modern	O
exploration	O
drilling	O
for	O
the	O
extensive	O
Anton	O
target.	O

Drill	O
targets	O
selected	O
by	O
the	O
Company	O
were	O
generally	O
shallower	O
targets	O
where	O
historical	O
records	O
indicated	O
that	O
effective	O
mining	O
was	O
prevented	O
by	O
water	O
ingress	O
due	O
to	O
the	O
poor	O
capability	O
of	O
primitive	O
pumps	O
of	O
the	O
era.	O

2	O
PROSPECH	O
LIMITED	O
and	O
its	O
controlled	O
entities	O
REVIEW	O
OF	O
OPERATIONS	O
The	O
Anton	O
target	O
is	O
a	O
large	O
system	O
of	O
epithermal	O
gold	O
and	O
silver	O
veins	O
,	O
with	O
a	O
known	O
strike	O
length	O
of	O
at	O
least	O
3.5	O
kilometres.	O

The	O
broader	O
Anton	O
structural	O

Geophysics	O
-	O

IP	O
Previous	O
drilling	O
by	O

at	O

and	O

to	O
test	O

targets	O
associated	O
with	O
the	O

of	O
a	O

which	O

’	O

Hodrusa-Hamre	O
exploration	O

first	O
time	O

the	O
Hodrusa-Hamre/Banska	O
Stiavnica	O

,	O

,	O

79	O
,	O
250	O
54	O
,	O
000	O
Remuneration	O
Report	O
-	O

(	O
Audited	O
)	O
All	O
amounts	O
in	O
this	O
remuneration	O
report	O
are	O
in	O
Australian	O
Dollars	O
unless	O
otherwise	O
stated.	O

Principles	O
of	O
Compensation	O
-	O

(	O
Audited	O
)	O
Key	O
management	O
personnel	O
have	O
authority	O
and	O
responsibility	O
for	O
planning	O
,	O
directing	O
and	O
controlling	O
the	O
activities	O
of	O
the	O
Group.	O

Key	O
management	O
personnel	O
comprise	O
the	O
Directors	O
of	O
the	O
Company.	O

No	O
other	O
employees	O
have	O
been	O
deemed	O
to	O
be	O
key	O
management	O
personnel.	O

The	O
policy	O
of	O
remuneration	O
of	O
Directors	O
and	O
senior	O
executives	O
is	O
to	O
ensure	O
the	O
remuneration	O
package	O
properly	O
reflects	O
the	O
person's	O
duties	O
and	O
responsibilities	O
,	O
and	O
that	O
remuneration	O
is	O
competitive	O
in	O
attracting	O
,	O
retaining	O
and	O
motivating	O
people	O
of	O
the	O
highest	O
quality.	O

Compensation	O
levels	O
have	O
been	O
,	O
and	O
will	O
be	O
,	O
set	O
to	O
be	O
in	O
line	O
with	O
Australian	O
listed	O
entities	O
of	O
equivalent	O
size	O
and	O
comparable	O
operations	O
in	O
order	O
to	O
attract	O
and	O
retain	O
suitably	O
qualified	O
and	O
experienced	O
key	O
management	O
personnel	O
but	O
also	O
having	O
regard	O
to	O
the	O
prevailing	O
financial	O
capacity	O
of	O
the	O
Company.	O

The	O
Board	O
is	O
responsible	O
for	O
reviewing	O
and	O
evaluating	O
its	O
own	O
performance.	O

The	O
evaluation	O
process	O
is	O
intended	O
to	O
assess	O
the	O
Group's	O
business	O
performance	O
,	O
whether	O
long	O
term	O
strategic	O
objectives	O
are	O
being	O
achieved	O
and	O
the	O
achievement	O
of	O
individual	O
performance	O
objectives.	O

Remuneration	O
generally	O
consists	O
of	O
salary	O
payments	O
comprising	O
both	O
short-term	O
salaries	O
and	O
share	O
based	O
payments.	O

The	O
remuneration	O
disclosed	O
below	O
represents	O
the	O
cost	O
to	O
the	O
Group	O
for	O
the	O
services	O
provided	O
under	O
these	O
arrangements.	O

Share	O
based	O
payments	O
are	O
issued	O
to	O
directors	O
to	O
incentivise	O
performance	O
that	O
contributes	O
to	O
shareholder	O
wealth.	O

There	O
were	O
no	O
remuneration	O
consultants	O
used	O
by	O
the	O
Company	O
during	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
31	O
December	O
2021	O
,	O
or	O
in	O
the	O
prior	O
year.	O

26	O
PROSPECH	O
LIMITED	O
and	O
its	O
controlled	O
entities	O
NOTES	O

FINANCIAL	O

FOR	O
THE	O
YEAR	O
ENDED	O
31	O
DECEMBER	O
2021	O
NOTE	O
1	O
–	O

REPORTING	O
ENTITY	O
Prospech	O
Limited	O
(	O
the	O
‘	O
Company	O
’	O
)	O
is	O
a	O
company	O
domiciled	O
in	O
Australia.	O

The	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
report	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
to	O
31	O
December	O
2021	O
comprises	O
the	O
Company	O
and	O
its	O
subsidiaries	O
(	O
together	O
referred	O
to	O
as	O
‘	O
Prospech	O
’	O
or	O
‘	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
Group	O
is	O
a	O
for-profit	O
entity	O
and	O
is	O
involved	O
in	O
exploration	O
for	O
precious	O
metals.	O

NOTE	O
2	O
–	O

BASIS	O
OF	O
PREPARATION	O
Statement	O
of	O
compliance	O
The	O
financial	O
report	O
is	O
a	O
general	O
purpose	O
financial	O
report	O
which	O
has	O
been	O
prepared	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
(	O
‘	O
AASBs	O
’	O
)	O
adopted	O
by	O
the	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
Board	O
(	O
‘	O
AASB	O
’	O
)	O
and	O
the	O
Corporations	O
Act	O
2001.	O

The	O
financial	O
report	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
complies	O
with	O
International	O
Financial	O
Reporting	O
Standards	O
(	O
IFRS	O
)	O
and	O
interpretations	O
adopted	O
by	O
the	O
International	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
Board	O
(	O
‘	O
IASB	O
’	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
financial	O
report	O
was	O
authorised	O
for	O
issue	O
by	O
the	O
Directors	O
on	O
30	O
March	O
2022.	O

Basis	O
of	O
measurement	O
The	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
statements	O
have	O
been	O
prepared	O
on	O
the	O
historical	O
cost	O
basis.	O

Functional	O
and	O
presentation	O
currency	O
These	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
presented	O
in	O
Australian	O
dollars	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
functional	O
currency.	O

The	O
functional	O
currency	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
subsidiaries	O
Prospech	O
Slovakia	O
s.r.o	O
and	O
Slovenske	O
Kovy	O
s.r.o	O
is	O
Euros.	O

Use	O
of	O
estimates	O
and	O
judgements	O
The	O
preparation	O
of	O
financial	O
statements	O
requires	O
management	O
to	O
make	O
judgements	O
,	O
estimates	O
and	O
assumptions	O
that	O
affect	O
the	O
application	O
of	O
accounting	O
policies	O
and	O
the	O
reported	O
amounts	O
of	O
assets	O
,	O
liabilities	O
,	O
income	O
and	O
expenses.	O

Actual	O
results	O
may	O
differ	O
from	O
these	O
estimates.	O

Estimates	O
and	O
underlying	O
assumptions	O
are	O
reviewed	O
on	O
an	O
ongoing	O
basis.	O

Revisions	O
to	O
accounting	O
estimates	O
are	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
period	O
in	O
which	O
the	O
estimate	O
is	O
revised	O
and	O
in	O
any	O
future	O
periods	O
affected.	O

In	O
particular	O
,	O
information	O
about	O
significant	O
areas	O
of	O
estimation	O
uncertainty	O
and	O
critical	O
judgements	O
in	O
applying	O
accounting	O
policies	O
that	O
have	O
the	O
most	O
significant	O
effect	O
on	O
the	O
amount	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
described	O
in	O
the	O
following	O
notes	O
:	O
-	O

Note	O
2	O
–	O

Going	O
concern	O
-	O

Note	O
6	O
–	O

Income	O
tax	O
expense	O
and	O
the	O
recoverability	O
of	O
deferred	O
tax	O
assets.	O

-	O

Note	O
8	O
–	O

Exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
expenditure	O
The	O

set	O
out	O
below	O
have	O
been	O

consistently	O
by	O
entities	O
in	O
the	O
Group.	O

27	O
PROSPECH	O
LIMITED	O
and	O
its	O
controlled	O
entities	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
FOR	O
THE	O
YEAR	O
ENDED	O
31	O
DECEMBER	O
2021	O
NOTE	O
2	O
–	O

BASIS	O
OF	O
PREPARATION	O
(	O
Con	O
’	O
t	O
)	O
Going	O
concern	O
The	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
statements	O
have	O
been	O
prepared	O
on	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
basis	O
,	O
which	O
contemplates	O
the	O
continuation	O
of	O
normal	O
business	O
operations	O
and	O
the	O
realisation	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
settlement	O
of	O
liabilities	O
in	O
the	O
normal	O
course	O
of	O
business.	O

For	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
31	O
December	O
2021	O
the	O
Group	O
has	O
incurred	O
a	O
loss	O
of	O
$969	O
,	O
857	O
and	O
has	O
accumulated	O
losses	O
of	O
$4	O
,	O
504	O
,	O
846	O
as	O
at	O
31	O
December	O
2021.	O

The	O
Group	O
used	O
$945	O
,	O
027	O
of	O
cash	O
in	O
operations	O
,	O
in	O
addition	O
to	O
$1	O
,	O
499	O
,	O
335	O
of	O
cash	O
for	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
expenditure	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
31	O
December	O
2021	O
,	O
and	O
had	O
cash	O
on	O
hand	O
of	O
$2	O
,	O
036	O
,	O
694	O
at	O
31	O
December	O
2021.	O

The	O
Directors	O
have	O
prepared	O
cash	O
flow	O
projections	O
for	O
the	O
period	O
from	O
1	O
January	O
2022	O
to	O
31	O
March	O
2023	O
that	O
support	O
the	O
ability	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern.	O

These	O
cash	O
flow	O
projections	O
assume	O
the	O
Group	O
continues	O
substantial	O
exploration	O
activities	O
in	O
the	O
areas	O
of	O
interest	O
,	O
which	O
will	O
require	O
additional	O
funding	O
from	O
shareholders	O
or	O
other	O
parties	O
that	O
is	O
yet	O
to	O
be	O
secured	O
at	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
this	O
report.	O

If	O
such	O
funding	O
is	O
not	O
secured	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
plans	O
to	O
reduce	O
expenditure	O
to	O
the	O
level	O
of	O
funding	O
available.	O

These	O
conditions	O
give	O
rise	O
to	O
a	O
material	O
uncertainty	O
that	O
may	O
cast	O
significant	O
doubt	O
upon	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
ability	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern.	O

The	O
ongoing	O
operations	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
are	O
dependent	O
upon	O
the	O
Group	O
raising	O
additional	O
funding	O
from	O
shareholders	O
or	O
other	O
parties	O
and/or	O
the	O
Group	O
reducing	O
expenditure	O
in-line	O
with	O
available	O
funding.	O

In	O
the	O
event	O
that	O
the	O
Group	O
does	O
not	O
obtain	O
additional	O
funding	O
and/or	O
reduce	O
expenditure	O
in	O
line	O
with	O
available	O
funding	O
,	O
the	O
achievement	O
of	O
which	O
is	O
significantly	O
uncertain	O
until	O
secured	O
or	O
realised	O
,	O
it	O
may	O
not	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
continue	O
its	O
operations	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
and	O
therefore	O
may	O
not	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
realise	O
its	O
assets	O
and	O
extinguish	O
its	O
liabilities	O
in	O
the	O
ordinary	O
course	O
of	O
operations	O
ad	O
at	O
the	O
amounts	O
stated	O
in	O
the	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
report.	O

NOTE	O
3	O
–	O

SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
Basis	O
of	O
consolidation	O
Subsidiaries	O
Subsidiaries	O
are	O
entities	O
controlled	O
by	O
the	O
Group.	O

The	O
Group	O
controls	O
an	O
entity	O
when	O
it	O
is	O
exposed	O
to	O
,	O
or	O
has	O
rights	O
to	O
,	O
variable	O
returns	O
from	O
its	O
involvement	O
with	O
the	O
entity	O
and	O
has	O
the	O
ability	O
to	O
affect	O
those	O
returns	O
through	O
its	O
power	O
over	O
the	O
entity.	O

The	O
financial	O
statements	O
of	O
subsidiaries	O
are	O
included	O
in	O
the	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
statements	O
from	O
the	O
date	O
that	O
control	O
commences	O
until	O
the	O
date	O
that	O
control	O
ceases.	O

Transactions	O
eliminated	O
on	O
consolidation	O
Intragroup	O
balances	O
and	O
any	O
unrealised	O
gains	O
and	O
losses	O
or	O
income	O
and	O
expenses	O
arising	O
from	O
intragroup	O
transactions	O
(	O
except	O
for	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
transaction	O
gains	O
or	O
losses	O
)	O
,	O
are	O
eliminated	O
in	O
preparing	O
the	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
statements.	O

Where	O
a	O
controlled	O
entity	O
issues	O
shares	O
to	O
minority	O
interests	O
which	O
does	O
not	O
result	O
in	O
loss	O
of	O
control	O
by	O
the	O
Group	O
,	O
any	O
gain	O
or	O
loss	O
arising	O
on	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
interest	O
in	O
the	O
controlled	O
entity	O
is	O
recognised	O
directly	O
in	O
equity.	O

Foreign	O
currency	O
Foreign	O
currency	O
transactions	O
Transactions	O
in	O
foreign	O
currencies	O
are	O
translated	O
at	O
the	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
rate	O
ruling	O
at	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
the	O
transaction.	O

Monetary	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
denominated	O
in	O
foreign	O
currencies	O
at	O
the	O
balance	O
sheet	O
date	O
are	O
translated	O
to	O
Australian	O
dollars	O
at	O
the	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
rate	O
ruling	O
at	O
that	O
date.	O

Non-monetary	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
that	O
are	O
measured	O
in	O
terms	O
of	O
historical	O
cost	O
in	O
a	O
foreign	O
currency	O
are	O
translated	O
using	O
the	O
exchange	O
rate	O
at	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
the	O
transaction.	O

Non-monetary	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
denominated	O
in	O

currencies	O
that	O
are	O
stated	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
are	O
translated	O
to	O
Australian	O
dollars	O

foreign	O

rates	O
ruling	O
at	O
the	O
dates	O
the	O
fair	O

was	O
determined.	O

Foreign	O
exchange	O
differences	O
arising	O
on	O
translation	O

the	O

ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O
Con	O
’	O
t	O
)	O
Financial	O
statements	O
of	O
foreign	O
operations	O
The	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
of	O
foreign	O
entities	O
are	O
translated	O
at	O
the	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
rates	O
ruling	O
at	O
the	O
reporting	O
date.	O

The	O
revenues	O
and	O
expenses	O
of	O
foreign	O
operations	O
are	O
translated	O
at	O
rates	O
approximating	O
the	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
rates	O
ruling	O
at	O
the	O
dates	O
of	O
the	O
transactions.	O

Foreign	O
exchange	O
differences	O
arising	O
on	O
retranslation	O
recognised	O
in	O
Other	O
Comprehensive	O
Income	O
(	O
‘	O
OCI	O
’	O
)	O
and	O
presented	O
in	O
the	O
foreign	O
currency	O
translation	O
reserve	O
(	O
‘	O
FCTR	O
’	O
)	O
,	O
a	O
separate	O
component	O
of	O
equity.	O

Foreign	O
exchange	O
gains	O
and	O
losses	O
arising	O
from	O
a	O
monetary	O
item	O
receivable	O
or	O
payable	O
to	O
a	O
foreign	O
operation	O
,	O
the	O
settlement	O
of	O
which	O
is	O
neither	O
planned	O
nor	O
likely	O
in	O
the	O
foreseeable	O
future	O
,	O
are	O
considered	O
to	O
form	O
part	O
of	O
a	O
net	O
investment	O
in	O
a	O
foreign	O
operation	O
and	O
are	O
recognised	O
directly	O
in	O
the	O
FCTR.	O

When	O
a	O
foreign	O
operation	O
is	O
disposed	O
of	O
,	O
in	O
part	O
or	O
in	O
full	O
,	O
the	O
relevant	O
amount	O
in	O
foreign	O
operation	O
and	O
are	O
recognised	O
in	O
OCI	O
and	O
presented	O
in	O
the	O
FCTR.	O

Financial	O
instruments	O
Non-derivative	O
financial	O
assets	O
Recognition	O
and	O
initial	O
measurement	O
The	O
Group	O
initially	O
recognises	O
trade	O
receivables	O
on	O
the	O
date	O
that	O
they	O
are	O
originated.	O

All	O
other	O
financial	O
assets	O
are	O
recognised	O
initially	O
on	O
the	O
trade	O
date	O
at	O
which	O
the	O
Group	O
becomes	O
a	O
party	O
to	O
the	O
contractual	O
provisions	O
of	O
the	O
instrument.	O

The	O
Group	O
derecognises	O
a	O
financial	O
asset	O
when	O
the	O
contractual	O
rights	O
to	O
the	O
cash	O
flows	O
from	O
the	O
asset	O
expire	O
,	O
or	O
it	O
transfers	O
the	O
rights	O
to	O
receive	O
the	O
contractual	O
cash	O
flows	O
on	O
the	O
financial	O
asset	O
in	O
a	O
transaction	O
in	O
which	O
substantially	O
all	O
the	O
risks	O
and	O
rewards	O
of	O
ownership	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
asset	O
are	O
transferred.	O

Any	O
interest	O
in	O
such	O
transferred	O
financial	O
assets	O
that	O
is	O
created	O
or	O
retained	O
by	O
the	O
Group	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O
a	O
separate	O
asset	O
or	O
liability.	O

Financial	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
are	O
offset	O
and	O
the	O
net	O
amount	O
presented	O
in	O

of	O
financial	O
position	O
when	O
,	O
and	O
only	O
when	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
has	O
a	O
legal	O
right	O
to	O
offset	O
the	O
amounts	O
and	O
intends	O
either	O
to	O
settle	O
them	O
on	O
a	O
net	O
basis	O
or	O
to	O
realise	O
the	O
asset	O
and	O
settle	O
the	O
liability	O
simultaneously.	O

On	O
initial	O
recognition	O
,	O
a	O
financial	O
asset	O
is	O
classified	O
as	O
subsequently	O
measured	O
at	O
:	O
-	O

amortised	O
cost	O
;	O
-	O

fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
;	O
or	O
-	O

fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

Financial	O
assets	O
are	O
not	O
reclassified	O
subsequent	O
to	O
their	O
initial	O
recognition	O
unless	O
the	O
Group	O
changes	O
its	O
business	O
model	O
for	O
managing	O
financial	O
assets	O
,	O
in	O
which	O
case	O
all	O
affected	O
financial	O
assets	O
are	O
reclassified	O
on	O
the	O
first	O
day	O
of	O
the	O
first	O
reporting	O
period	O
following	O
the	O
change	O
in	O
the	O
business	O
model.	O

A	O
financial	O
asset	O
is	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
if	O
it	O
meets	O
both	O
the	O
following	O
conditions	O
and	O
is	O
not	O
designated	O
as	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
:	O
-	O

it	O
is	O
held	O
within	O
a	O
business	O
model	O
whose	O
objective	O
is	O
to	O
hold	O
assets	O
to	O
collect	O
contractual	O
cash	O
flows	O
;	O
and	O
-	O

its	O
contractual	O
terms	O
give	O
rise	O
on	O
specified	O
dates	O
to	O
cash	O
flows	O
that	O
are	O
solely	O
payments	O
of	O
principal	O
and	O
interest	O
on	O
the	O
principal	O
amount	O
outstanding.	O

On	O
initial	O
recognition	O
of	O
an	O
equity	O
investment	O
that	O
is	O
not	O
held	O
for	O
trading	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
may	O
irrevocably	O
elect	O
to	O
present	O
subsequent	O
changes	O
in	O
the	O
investment	O
’	O
s	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
OCI.	O

This	O
election	O
is	O
made	O
on	O
an	O
investment-by-investment	O
basis.	O

ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O
Con	O
’	O
t	O
)	O
Financial	O
instruments	O
(	O
Cont	O
’	O
d	O
)	O
Non-derivative	O
financial	O
assets	O
(	O
Cont	O
’	O
d	O
)	O
All	O
financial	O
assets	O
not	O
classified	O
as	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
or	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
as	O
described	O
above	O
are	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

This	O
includes	O
all	O
derivative	O
financial	O
assets.	O

On	O
initial	O
recognition	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
may	O
irrevocably	O
designate	O
a	O
financial	O
asset	O
that	O
otherwise	O
meets	O
the	O
requirements	O
to	O
be	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
or	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
as	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
if	O
doing	O
so	O
eliminates	O
or	O
significantly	O
reduces	O
an	O
accounting	O
mismatch	O
that	O
would	O
otherwise	O
arise.	O

Financial	O
assets	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
These	O
assets	O
are	O
subsequently	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
using	O
the	O
effective	O
interest	O
method.	O

The	O
amortised	O
cost	O
is	O
reduced	O
by	O
impairment	O
losses.	O

Interest	O
income	O
,	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
gains	O
and	O
losses	O
and	O
impairment	O
are	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

Any	O
gain	O
or	O
loss	O
on	O
derecognition	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

Equity	O
instruments	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
These	O
assets	O
are	O
subsequently	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value.	O

Dividends	O
are	O
recognised	O
as	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
income	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
unless	O
the	O
dividend	O
clearly	O
represents	O
a	O
recovery	O
of	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
the	O
investment.	O

Other	O
net	O
gains	O
and	O
losses	O
are	O
recognised	O
in	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
and	O
are	O
never	O
reclassified	O
to	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

Non-derivative	O
financial	O
liabilities	O
Financial	O
liabilities	O
are	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost.	O

The	O
Group	O
initially	O
recognises	O
debt	O
securities	O
issued	O
and	O
subordinated	O
liabilities	O
on	O
the	O
date	O
that	O
they	O
are	O
originated.	O

All	O
other	O
financial	O
liabilities	O
are	O
recognised	O
initially	O
on	O
the	O
trade	O
date	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
the	O
date	O
that	O
the	O
Group	O
becomes	O
a	O
party	O
to	O
the	O
contractual	O
provisions	O
of	O
the	O
instrument.	O

The	O
Group	O
derecognises	O
a	O
financial	O
liability	O
when	O
its	O
contractual	O
obligations	O
are	O
discharged	O
,	O
cancelled	O
or	O
expire.	O

Other	O
financial	O
liabilities	O
comprise	O
loans	O
and	O
borrowings	O
and	O
trade	O
and	O
other	O
payables.	O

Impairment	O
Financial	O
assets	O
The	O
Group	O
recognises	O
expected	O
credit	O
losses	O
(	O
‘	O
ECLs	O
’	O
)	O
on	O
financial	O
assets	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
and	O
contract	O
assets.	O

The	O
Group	O
measures	O
loss	O
allowances	O
at	O
an	O
amount	O
equal	O
to	O
lifetime	O
ECLs	O
,	O
except	O
for	O
the	O
following	O
,	O
which	O
are	O
measured	O
at	O
12-month	O
ECLs	O
:	O
-	O

other	O
debt	O
securities	O
and	O
bank	O
balances	O
for	O
which	O
credit	O
risk	O
(	O
i.e.	O

the	O
risk	O
of	O
default	O
occurring	O
over	O
the	O
expected	O
life	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
instrument	O
)	O
has	O
not	O
increased	O
significantly	O
since	O
initial	O
recognition.	O

Loss	O
allowances	O
for	O
trade	O
receivables	O
and	O
contract	O
assets	O
are	O
always	O
measured	O
at	O
an	O
amount	O
equal	O
to	O
lifetime	O
ECLs.	O

At	O
each	O
reporting	O
date	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
assesses	O
whether	O
financial	O
assets	O
carried	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
and	O
debt	O
securities	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
are	O
credit-impaired.	O

Loss	O
allowances	O
for	O
financial	O
assets	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
are	O
deducted	O
from	O
the	O
gross	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
assets.	O

For	O
debt	O
securities	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
,	O
the	O
loss	O
allowance	O
is	O
charged	O
to	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
and	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income.	O

30	O
PROSPECH	O
LIMITED	O
and	O
its	O
controlled	O
entities	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
FOR	O
THE	O
YEAR	O
ENDED	O
31	O
DECEMBER	O
2021	O
NOTE	O
3	O
–	O

SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O
Con	O
’	O
t	O
)	O
Impairment	O
(	O
con	O
’	O
t	O
)	O
Financial	O
assets	O
(	O
con	O
’	O
t	O
)	O
The	O
gross	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
a	O
financial	O
asset	O
is	O
written	O
off	O
when	O
the	O
Group	O
has	O
no	O
reasonable	O
expectations	O
of	O
recovering	O
a	O
financial	O
asset	O
in	O
its	O
entirety	O
or	O
a	O
portion	O
thereof.	O

Non-financial	O
assets	O
The	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
assets	O
,	O
other	O
than	O
deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
,	O
are	O
reviewed	O
at	O
each	O
balance	O
sheet	O
date	O
to	O
determine	O
whether	O
there	O
is	O
any	O
indication	O
of	O
impairment.	O

If	O
any	O
such	O
indication	O
exists	O
,	O
the	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
is	O
estimated.	O

An	O
impairment	O
loss	O
is	O
recognised	O
whenever	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
its	O
cash-generating	O
unit	O
exceeds	O
its	O
recoverable	O
amount.	O

Impairment	O
losses	O
are	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
income	O
statement	O
,	O
unless	O
an	O
asset	O
has	O
previously	O
been	O
revalued	O
,	O
in	O
which	O
case	O
the	O
impairment	O
loss	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O
a	O
reversal	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
of	O
that	O
previous	O
revaluation	O
with	O
any	O
excess	O
recognised	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

Calculation	O
of	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
The	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
of	O
assets	O
is	O
the	O
greater	O
of	O
their	O
fair	O
value	O
less	O
costs	O
to	O
sell	O
and	O
value	O
in	O
use.	O

In	O
assessing	O
value	O
in	O
use	O
,	O
the	O
estimated	O
future	O
cash	O
flows	O
are	O
discounted	O
to	O
their	O
present	O
value	O
using	O
a	O
pre-tax	O
discount	O
rate	O
that	O
reflects	O
current	O
market	O
assessments	O
of	O
the	O
time	O
value	O
of	O
money	O
and	O
the	O
risks	O
specific	O
to	O
the	O
asset.	O

For	O
an	O
asset	O
that	O
does	O
not	O
generate	O
largely	O
independent	O
cash	O
inflows	O
,	O
the	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
is	O
determined	O
for	O
the	O
cash-generating	O
unit	O
to	O
which	O
the	O
asset	O
belongs.	O

Reversals	O
of	O
impairment	O
An	O
impairment	O
loss	O
is	O
reversed	O
only	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
the	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
carrying	O
amount	O
does	O
not	O
exceed	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
that	O
would	O
have	O
been	O
determined	O
,	O
net	O
of	O
depreciation	O
or	O
amortisation	O
,	O
if	O
no	O
impairment	O
loss	O
had	O
been	O
recognised.	O

Share	O
capital	O
Transaction	O
costs	O
Incremental	O
costs	O
directly	O
attributable	O
to	O
an	O
equity	O
transaction	O
are	O
accounted	O
for	O
as	O
a	O
deduction	O
from	O
equity	O
,	O
net	O
of	O
any	O
related	O
income	O
tax	O
benefit.	O

Dividends	O
Dividends	O
are	O
recognised	O
as	O
a	O
liability	O
in	O
the	O
period	O
in	O
which	O
they	O
are	O
declared.	O

Trade	O
and	O
other	O
payables	O
Trade	O
and	O
other	O
payables	O
are	O
stated	O
at	O
their	O
amortised	O
cost.	O

Trade	O
payables	O
are	O
non-interest	O
bearing	O
and	O
are	O
normally	O
settled	O
on	O
30	O
day	O
terms.	O

Expenses	O
Net	O
financing	O
income	O
Net	O
financing	O
costs	O
comprise	O
interest	O
payable	O
on	O
borrowings	O
calculated	O
using	O
the	O
effective	O
interest	O
method	O
,	O
interest	O
earned	O
and	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
gains	O
and	O
losses.	O

Interest	O
income	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
income	O
statement	O
as	O
it	O
accrues	O
,	O
using	O
the	O
effective	O
interest	O
method.	O

Dividend	O
income	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
income	O
statement	O
on	O
the	O
date	O
the	O
entity	O
’	O
s	O
right	O
to	O
receive	O
payment	O
is	O
established.	O

PROSPECH	O

SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O

’	O
t	O
)	O
Equity	O
settled	O
share	O
based	O
payments	O
The	O
grant-date	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
equity	O
settled	O
share	O
based	O
payment	O
awards	O
granted	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O
an	O
administration	O
and	O
consultants	O
’	O
expense	O
,	O
with	O
a	O
corresponding	O
increase	O
in	O
equity	O
,	O
over	O
the	O
period	O
that	O
the	O
employee	O
becomes	O
unconditionally	O
entitled	O
to	O
the	O
awards.	O

The	O
amount	O
recognised	O
as	O
an	O
expense	O
is	O
adjusted	O
to	O
reflect	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
awards	O
for	O
which	O
the	O
related	O
service	O
and	O
non-market	O
vesting	O
conditions	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
met	O
,	O
such	O
that	O
the	O
amount	O
ultimately	O
recognised	O
as	O
an	O
expense	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
awards	O
that	O
meet	O
the	O
related	O
service	O
and	O
non-market	O
performance	O
conditions	O
at	O
vesting	O
date.	O

For	O
market	O
conditions	O
and	O
non-vesting	O
conditions	O
,	O
the	O
grant	O
date	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
share	O
based	O
payment	O
is	O
measured	O
to	O
reflect	O
such	O
conditions	O
and	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
true-up	O
for	O
differences	O
between	O
expected	O
and	O
actual	O
outcomes.	O

Borrowings	O
Borrowings	O
are	O
initially	O
recognised	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
net	O
of	O
transaction	O
costs	O
incurred.	O

Borrowings	O
are	O
subsequently	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost.	O

Any	O
difference	O
between	O
the	O
proceeds	O
(	O
net	O
of	O
transaction	O
costs	O
)	O
and	O
the	O
redemption	O
amount	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
income	O
statement	O
over	O
the	O
period	O
of	O
the	O
borrowings	O
using	O
the	O
effective	O
interest	O
method.	O

Borrowings	O
are	O
classified	O
as	O
current	O
liabilities	O
unless	O
the	O
Group	O
has	O
an	O
unconditional	O
right	O
to	O
defer	O
settlement	O
of	O
the	O
liability	O
for	O
at	O
least	O
12	O
months	O
after	O
the	O
balance	O
sheet	O
date.	O

Borrowing	O
costs	O
which	O
are	O
directly	O
attributable	O
to	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
and	O
development	O
activities	O
are	O
capitalised	O
in	O
relation	O
to	O
qualifying	O
assets.	O

Income	O
tax	O
Income	O
tax	O
on	O
the	O
income	O
statement	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
comprises	O
current	O
and	O
deferred	O
tax.	O

Income	O
tax	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
income	O
statement	O
except	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
it	O
relates	O
to	O
items	O
recognised	O
directly	O
in	O
equity	O
,	O
in	O
which	O
case	O
it	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
equity.	O

Current	O
tax	O
is	O
the	O
expected	O
tax	O
payable	O
on	O
the	O
taxable	O
income	O
for	O
the	O
period	O
,	O
using	O
tax	O
rates	O
enacted	O
or	O
substantially	O
enacted	O
at	O
the	O
balance	O
sheet	O
date	O
,	O
and	O
any	O
adjustment	O
to	O
tax	O
payable	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
previous	O
periods.	O

Deferred	O
tax	O
is	O
provided	O
using	O
the	O
balance	O
sheet	O
liability	O
method	O
,	O
providing	O
for	O
temporary	O
differences	O
between	O
the	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
for	O
financial	O
reporting	O
purposes	O
and	O
the	O
amounts	O
used	O
for	O
taxation	O
purposes.	O

The	O
following	O
temporary	O
differences	O
are	O
not	O
provided	O
for	O
:	O
-	O

the	O
initial	O
recognition	O
of	O
assets	O
or	O
liabilities	O
that	O
affect	O
neither	O
accounting	O
nor	O
taxable	O
profit	O
and	O
differences	O
relating	O
to	O
investments	O
in	O
subsidiaries	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
they	O
will	O
probably	O
not	O
reverse	O
in	O
the	O
foreseeable	O
future	O
;	O
and	O
-	O

the	O
amount	O
of	O
deferred	O
tax	O
provided	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
expected	O
manner	O
of	O
realisation	O
or	O
settlement	O
of	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
,	O
using	O
tax	O
rates	O
enacted	O
or	O
substantively	O
enacted	O
at	O
the	O
balance	O
sheet	O
date.	O

A	O
deferred	O
tax	O
asset	O
is	O
recognised	O
only	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
future	O
taxable	O
profits	O
will	O
be	O
available	O
against	O
which	O
the	O
asset	O
can	O
be	O
utilised.	O

Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
are	O
reduced	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
no	O
longer	O
probable	O
that	O
the	O
related	O
tax	O
benefit	O
will	O
be	O
realised.	O

POLICIES	O
(	O

’	O
t	O
)	O
Goods	O
and	O
services	O
tax	O
Revenue	O
,	O
expenses	O
and	O
assets	O
are	O
recognised	O
net	O
of	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
goods	O
and	O
services	O
tax	O
(	O
‘	O
GST	O
’	O
)	O
,	O
except	O
where	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
GST	O
incurred	O
is	O
not	O
recoverable	O
from	O
the	O
taxation	O
authority.	O

In	O
these	O

,	O
the	O
GST	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
acquisition	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
expense.	O

Receivables	O
and	O
payables	O
are	O
stated	O
with	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
GST	O
included.	O

The	O
net	O
amount	O
of	O
GST	O
recoverable	O
from	O
,	O
or	O
payable	O
to	O
,	O
the	O
Australian	O
Taxation	O
Office	O
is	O
included	O
as	O
a	O
current	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position.	O

Cash	O
flows	O
are	O
included	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
cash	O
flows	O
on	O
a	O
gross	O
basis.	O

The	O
GST	O
components	O
of	O
cash	O
flows	O
arising	O
from	O
investing	O
and	O
financing	O
activities	O
which	O
are	O
recoverable	O
from	O
,	O
or	O
payable	O
to	O
,	O
the	O
Australian	O
Taxation	O
Office	O
are	O
classified	O
as	O
operating	O
cash	O
flows.	O

Segment	O
Reporting	O
Determination	O
and	O
presentation	O
of	O
operating	O
segments	O
The	O
Group	O
determines	O
and	O
presents	O
operating	O
segments	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
information	O
that	O
is	O
provided	O
internally	O
to	O
Executive	O
Director	O
and	O
the	O
CFO	O
,	O
who	O
are	O
the	O
Group's	O
chief	O
operating	O
decision	O
makers.	O

An	O
operating	O
segment	O
is	O
a	O
component	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
that	O
engages	O
in	O
business	O
activities	O
from	O
which	O
it	O
may	O
earn	O
revenues	O
and	O
incur	O
expenses	O
,	O
including	O
revenues	O
and	O
expenses	O
that	O
relate	O
to	O
transactions	O
with	O
any	O
of	O
the	O
Group's	O
other	O
components.	O

All	O
operating	O
segments'	O
operating	O
results	O
are	O
regularly	O
reviewed	O
by	O
the	O
Group's	O
Executive	O
Directors	O
to	O
make	O
decisions	O
about	O
resources	O
to	O
be	O
allocated	O
to	O
the	O
segment	O
and	O
assess	O
its	O
performance	O
,	O
and	O
for	O
which	O
discrete	O
financial	O
information	O
is	O
available.	O

Segment	O
results	O
that	O
are	O
reported	O
to	O
Executive	O
Directors	O
include	O
items	O
directly	O
attributable	O
to	O
a	O
segment	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
those	O
that	O
can	O
be	O
allocated	O
on	O
a	O
reasonable	O
basis.	O

Unallocated	O
items	O
comprise	O
mainly	O
corporate	O
assets	O
(	O
primarily	O
the	O
Company's	O
headquarters	O
)	O
and	O
head	O
office	O
expenses.	O

Segment	O
capital	O
expenditure	O
is	O
the	O
total	O
cost	O
incurred	O
during	O
the	O
period	O
to	O
acquire	O
property	O
,	O
plant	O
and	O
equipment	O
,	O
and	O
intangible	O
assets	O
other	O
than	O
goodwill.	O

Cash	O
and	O
cash	O
equivalents	O
Cash	O
and	O
cash	O
equivalents	O
comprise	O
cash	O
balances	O
and	O
call	O
deposits	O
with	O
an	O
original	O
maturity	O
of	O
three	O
months	O
or	O
less.	O

Employee	O
benefits	O
Wages	O
,	O
salaries	O
,	O
annual	O
leave	O
,	O
sick	O
leave	O
and	O
non-monetary	O
benefits	O
Liabilities	O
for	O
employee	O
benefits	O
for	O
wages	O
,	O
salaries	O
,	O
annual	O
leave	O
and	O
sick	O

that	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O

within	O
12	O
months	O
of	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
represent	O
present	O

resulting	O
from	O
employees'	O
services	O
provided	O
to	O
reporting	O
date	O
,	O
are	O
calculated	O
at	O
undiscounted	O
amounts	O
based	O
on	O
remuneration	O
wage	O
and	O
salary	O
rates	O
that	O
the	O
Group	O
expects	O
to	O
pay	O
as	O
at	O
reporting	O
date	O
and	O
payroll	O
tax.	O

Provisions	O
A	O
provision	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
balance	O
sheet	O
when	O
the	O
Group	O
has	O
a	O
present	O
legal	O
or	O
constructive	O
obligation	O
as	O
a	O
result	O
of	O
a	O
past	O
event	O
,	O
and	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
an	O
outflow	O
of	O
economic	O
benefits	O
will	O
be	O
required	O
to	O
settle	O
the	O
obligation.	O

If	O
the	O
effect	O
is	O
material	O
,	O
provisions	O
are	O
determined	O
by	O
discounting	O
the	O
expected	O
future	O
cash	O
flows	O
at	O
a	O
pre-tax	O

that	O
reflects	O
current	O
market	O

of	O
the	O
time	O
value	O
of	O
money	O
and	O
,	O
when	O
appropriate	O
,	O
the	O
risks	O
specific	O
to	O
the	O
liability.	O

SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O
Con	O
’	O
t	O
)	O
Site	O
restoration	O
In	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O

policy	O
and	O
applicable	O

requirements	O
,	O
a	O

for	O

of	O

,	O
and	O

,	O
is	O
recognised	O
when	O
the	O

is	O
disturbed.	O

Determination	O
of	O
fair	O
values	O
A	O
number	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
accounting	O
policies	O
and	O
disclosures	O
require	O
the	O
determination	O
of	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
for	O
both	O
financial	O
and	O
non-	O
financial	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities.	O

Fair	O
values	O
have	O
been	O
determined	O
for	O
measurement	O
and/or	O
disclosure	O
purposes	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
following	O
methods.	O

Where	O
applicable	O
,	O
further	O
information	O
about	O
the	O
assumptions	O
made	O
in	O

fair	O
values	O
is	O
disclosed	O
in	O
the	O
notes	O
specific	O
to	O
that	O
asset	O
or	O
liability.	O

Trade	O
and	O
other	O
receivables	O
The	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
trade	O
and	O
other	O
receivables	O
is	O
estimated	O
as	O
the	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
future	O
cash	O
flows	O
,	O
discounted	O
at	O
the	O
market	O
rate	O
of	O
interest	O
at	O
the	O
reporting	O
date.	O

Non-derivative	O
financial	O
liabilities	O
Fair	O
value	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
determined	O
for	O
disclosure	O
purposes	O
,	O
is	O
calculated	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
future	O
principal	O
and	O
interest	O
cash	O
flows	O
,	O
discounted	O
at	O
the	O
market	O
rate	O
of	O
interest	O
at	O
the	O
reporting	O
date.	O

Exploration	O
,	O
evaluation	O
and	O
development	O
expenditure	O
Exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
costs	O
,	O
including	O
the	O
costs	O
of	O
acquiring	O
licences	O
,	O
are	O
capitalised	O
at	O
cost	O
or	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
as	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
assets	O
on	O
an	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
basis.	O

Costs	O
incurred	O
before	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
has	O
obtained	O
the	O
legal	O
rights	O
to	O
explore	O
an	O
area	O
are	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
comprehensive	O
income.	O

Exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
assets	O
are	O
only	O
recognised	O
if	O
the	O
rights	O
of	O
the	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
are	O
current	O
and	O
either	O
:	O
-	O

the	O
expenditures	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
recouped	O
through	O
successful	O
development	O
and	O
exploitation	O
of	O
the	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
;	O
or	O
-	O

activities	O
in	O
the	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
have	O
not	O
at	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
,	O
reached	O
a	O
stage	O
which	O
permits	O
a	O
reasonable	O
assessment	O
of	O
the	O
existence	O
or	O
otherwise	O
of	O
economically	O
recoverable	O
reserves	O
and	O
active	O
and	O
significant	O
operations	O
in	O
,	O
or	O
in	O
relation	O
to	O
,	O
the	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
are	O
continuing.	O

Exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
assets	O
are	O
assessed	O
for	O
impairment	O
if	O
sufficient	O
data	O
exists	O
to	O
determine	O
technical	O
feasibility	O
and	O
commercial	O
viability	O
and	O
facts	O
and	O
circumstances	O
suggest	O
that	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
exceeds	O
the	O
recoverable	O
amount.	O

For	O
the	O
purposes	O
of	O
impairment	O
testing	O
,	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
assets	O
are	O
allocated	O
to	O
cash-generating	O
units	O
to	O
which	O
the	O
exploration	O
activity	O
relates.	O

The	O
cash	O
generating	O
unit	O
shall	O
not	O
be	O
larger	O
than	O
the	O
area	O
of	O
interest.	O

Once	O
the	O
technical	O
feasibility	O
and	O
commercial	O
viability	O
of	O
the	O
extraction	O
of	O
mineral	O
resources	O
in	O
an	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
are	O
demonstrable	O
,	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
assets	O
attributable	O
to	O
that	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
are	O
first	O
tested	O
for	O
impairment	O
and	O
then	O
reclassified	O
from	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
expenditure	O
to	O
mining	O
property	O
and	O
development	O
assets	O
within	O
property	O
,	O
plant	O
and	O
equipment.	O

34	O

SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O
Con	O
’	O
t	O
)	O
Share	O
based	O
payment	O
transactions	O
The	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
share	O
options	O
is	O
measured	O
using	O
the	O
Black-Scholes	O
formula.	O

Measurement	O
inputs	O
include	O
share	O
price	O
on	O
measurement	O
date	O
,	O
exercise	O
price	O
of	O
the	O
instrument	O
,	O
expected	O
volatility	O
(	O
based	O
on	O
weighted	O
average	O
historic	O
volatility	O
)	O
,	O
expected	O
dividends	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
risk-free	O
interest	O
rate	O
(	O
based	O
on	O
government	O
bonds	O
)	O
.	O

Changes	O
in	O
significant	O
accounting	O
policies	O

new	O
standards	O
and	O
interpretations	O
effective	O
for	O

1	O

by	O

in	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
these	O
financial	O
statements	O
and	O
have	O
not	O
had	O
any	O
material	O
effect	O
on	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
presented.	O

standards	O
and	O
interpretations	O
not	O
yet	O
adopted	O

number	O
of	O
new	O
standards	O

standards	O
and	O
interpretations	O
are	O

to	O
be	O
early	O
adopted	O
for	O
annual	O
periods	O
beginning	O
after	O
1	O

2021	O
and	O
have	O

been	O
applied	O

Ordinary	O
shares	O
The	O
Company	O
does	O
not	O
have	O
authorised	O
capital	O
or	O
par	O
value	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
its	O
issued	O
shares.	O

All	O
issued	O
shares	O
are	O
fully	O
paid.	O

The	O
holders	O
of	O
ordinary	O
shares	O
are	O
entitled	O
to	O
voting	O
rights	O
and	O
receive	O
dividends	O
as	O
declared	O
from	O
time	O
to	O
time.	O

Nature	O
and	O
purpose	O
of	O
reserves	O
Acquisition	O
reserve	O
The	O
acquisition	O
reserve	O
reflects	O
the	O
transaction	O
with	O
the	O
non-controlling	O
interest	O
following	O
the	O
acquisition	O
by	O
the	O
Company	O
of	O
an	O
additional	O
30%	O
interest	O
in	O
Slovenske	O
Kovy	O
s.r.o	O
(	O
‘	O
SLOK	O
’	O
)	O
on	O
completion	O
of	O
tranche	O
3	O
on	O
31	O
December	O
2016	O
and	O
the	O
remaining	O
19%	O
in	O
October	O
2017.	O

Foreign	O
currency	O
translation	O
reserve	O
The	O
foreign	O
currency	O
translation	O
reserve	O
records	O
the	O
foreign	O
currency	O
differences	O
arising	O
from	O
the	O
translation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
of	O
foreign	O
operations	O
where	O
their	O
functional	O
currency	O
is	O
different	O
to	O
the	O
presentation	O
currency	O
of	O
the	O
reporting	O
entity.	O

Option	O
premium	O
reserve	O
The	O
option	O
premium	O
reserve	O
is	O
used	O
to	O
recognise	O
the	O
grant	O
date	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
options	O
issued	O
but	O
not	O
exercised.	O

42	O
PROSPECH	O
LIMITED	O
and	O
its	O
controlled	O
entities	O

TO	O

STATEMENTS	O

YEAR	O
ENDED	O
31	O
DECEMBER	O
2021	O

11	O
–	O

CAPITAL	O
AND	O
RESERVES	O
(	O

’	O

NOTE	O
16	O
–	O

FINANCIAL	O
RISK	O
MANAGEMENT	O
AND	O
FINANCIAL	O
INSTRUMENTS	O
DISCLOSURE	O
The	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
financial	O
instruments	O
comprise	O
deposits	O
with	O
banks	O
,	O
receivables	O
,	O
trade	O
and	O
other	O
payables	O
and	O
from	O
time	O
to	O
time	O
short	O
term	O
loans	O
from	O
related	O
parties.	O

The	O
Group	O
does	O
not	O
trade	O
in	O
derivatives.	O

The	O
main	O
risks	O
arising	O
from	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
financial	O
instruments	O
are	O
credit	O
risk	O
,	O
liquidity	O
risk	O
,	O
currency	O
risk	O
and	O
interest	O
rate	O
risk.	O

The	O
summaries	O
below	O
present	O
information	O
about	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
exposure	O
to	O
each	O
of	O
these	O
risks	O
,	O
their	O
objectives	O
,	O
policies	O
and	O
processes	O
for	O
measuring	O
and	O
managing	O
risk	O
,	O
the	O
management	O
of	O
capital	O
and	O
financial	O
instruments.	O

Risk	O
management	O
framework	O
The	O
Board	O
of	O
Directors	O
has	O
overall	O
responsibility	O
for	O
the	O
establishment	O
and	O
oversight	O
of	O
the	O
risk	O
management	O
framework.	O

Risk	O
management	O
policies	O
are	O
established	O
to	O
identify	O
and	O
analyse	O
the	O
risks	O
faced	O
by	O
the	O
Group	O
,	O
to	O
set	O
appropriate	O
risk	O
limits	O
and	O
controls	O
,	O
and	O
to	O
monitor	O
risks	O
and	O
adherence	O
to	O
limits.	O

These	O
policies	O
are	O
reviewed	O
regularly	O
to	O
reflect	O
changes	O
in	O
market	O
conditions	O
and	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
activities.	O

The	O
primary	O
responsibility	O
to	O
monitor	O
the	O
financial	O
risks	O
lies	O
with	O
the	O
Managing	O
Director	O
and	O
the	O
Company	O
Secretary	O
under	O
the	O
authority	O
of	O
the	O
Board.	O

46	O
PROSPECH	O
LIMITED	O
and	O
its	O
controlled	O
entities	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
FOR	O
THE	O
YEAR	O
ENDED	O
31	O
DECEMBER	O
2021	O
NOTE	O
16	O
–	O

FINANCIAL	O
INSTRUMENTS	O
DISCLOSURE	O
(	O
Con	O
’	O
t	O
)	O
Credit	O
risk	O
Credit	O
risk	O
arises	O
mainly	O
from	O
the	O
risk	O
of	O
counterparties	O
defaulting	O

Other	O
Information	O
Other	O
Information	O
is	O
financial	O
and	O
non-financial	O
information	O
in	O
Prospech	O
Limited	O
’	O
s	O
annual	O
reporting	O
which	O
is	O
provided	O
in	O
addition	O
to	O
the	O
Financial	O
Report	O
and	O
the	O
Auditor	O
’	O
s	O
Report.	O

The	O
Directors	O
are	O
responsible	O
for	O
the	O
Other	O
Information.	O

Our	O
opinion	O
on	O
the	O
Financial	O
Report	O
does	O
not	O
cover	O
the	O
Other	O
Information	O
and	O
,	O
accordingly	O
,	O
we	O
do	O
not	O
express	O
an	O
audit	O
opinion	O
or	O
any	O
form	O
of	O
assurance	O
conclusion	O
thereon	O
,	O
with	O
the	O
exception	O
of	O
the	O
Remuneration	O
Report	O
and	O
our	O
related	O
assurance	O
opinion.	O

In	O
connection	O
with	O
our	O
audit	O
of	O
the	O
Financial	O
Report	O
,	O
our	O
responsibility	O
is	O
to	O
read	O
the	O
Other	O
Information.	O

In	O
doing	O
so	O
,	O
we	O
consider	O
whether	O
the	O
Other	O
Information	O
is	O
materially	O
inconsistent	O
with	O
the	O
Financial	O
Report	O
or	O
our	O
knowledge	O
obtained	O
in	O
the	O
audit	O
,	O
or	O
otherwise	O
appears	O
to	O
be	O
materially	O
misstated.	O

We	O
are	O
required	O
to	O
report	O
if	O
we	O
conclude	O
that	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
material	O
misstatement	O
of	O
this	O
Other	O
Information	O
,	O
and	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
work	O
we	O
have	O
performed	O
on	O
the	O
Other	O
Information	O
that	O
we	O
obtained	O
prior	O
to	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
this	O
Auditor	O
’	O
s	O
Report	O
we	O
have	O
nothing	O
to	O
report.	O

Responsibilities	O
of	O
the	O
Directors	O
for	O
the	O
Financial	O
Report	O
The	O
Directors	O
are	O
responsible	O
for	O
:	O
	O

preparing	O
the	O
Financial	O
Report	O
that	O
gives	O
a	O
true	O
and	O
fair	O
view	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
and	O
the	O
Corporations	O
Act	O
2001	O
	O

implementing	O
necessary	O
internal	O
control	O
to	O
enable	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
a	O
Financial	O
Report	O
that	O
gives	O
a	O
true	O
and	O
fair	O
view	O
and	O
is	O
free	O
from	O
material	O
misstatement	O
,	O
whether	O
due	O
to	O
fraud	O
or	O
error	O
	O

assessing	O
the	O
Group	O
and	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
ability	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
and	O
whether	O
the	O
56	O
use	O
of	O
the	O
going	O
concern	O
basis	O
of	O
accounting	O
is	O
appropriate.	O

This	O
includes	O
disclosing	O
,	O
as	O
applicable	O
,	O
matters	O
related	O
to	O
going	O
concern	O
and	O
using	O
the	O
going	O
concern	O
basis	O
of	O
accounting	O
unless	O
they	O
either	O
intend	O
to	O
liquidate	O
the	O
Group	O
and	O
Company	O
or	O
to	O
cease	O
operations	O

have	O
no	O

to	O
do	O
so.	O

Auditor	O
’	O
s	O
responsibilities	O
for	O
the	O
audit	O
of	O
the	O
Financial	O
Report	O
Our	O
objective	O
is	O
:	O
	O

to	O
obtain	O
reasonable	O
assurance	O
about	O
whether	O
the	O
Financial	O
Report	O
as	O
a	O
whole	O
is	O
free	O
from	O
material	O
misstatement	O
,	O
whether	O
due	O
to	O
fraud	O
or	O
error	O
;	O
and	O
	O

to	O
issue	O
an	O
Auditor	O
’	O
s	O
Report	O
that	O
includes	O
our	O
opinion.	O

Reasonable	O
assurance	O
is	O
a	O
high	O
level	O
of	O
assurance	O
,	O
but	O
is	O
not	O
a	O
guarantee	O
that	O
an	O
audit	O
conducted	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
Australian	O
Auditing	O
Standards	O
will	O
always	O
detect	O
a	O
material	O
misstatement	O
when	O
it	O
exists.	O

Misstatements	O
can	O
arise	O
from	O
fraud	O
or	O
error.	O

They	O
are	O
considered	O
material	O
if	O
,	O
individually	O
or	O
in	O
the	O
aggregate	O
,	O
they	O
could	O
reasonably	O
be	O
expected	O
to	O
influence	O
the	O
economic	O
decisions	O
of	O
users	O
taken	O
on	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
the	O
Financial	O
Report.	O

*	O
1m	O

4m	O
composites.	O
